name: Cassandra Mackey
text: The staff is phenomenal there!! From the phone call to confirm I was coming to my appointment to the day I went into the office, they are so sweet over the phone and even nicer in person. I saw Dr.Moore and Dr.Kyatt they both were very kind, caring, and compassionate. They sat with me and explained all of my different options until I completely understood all of my treatment. All of the assistants, hygienist and all of the girls up front and the office manager were so great! The office manager worked with me financially, I was able to pay monthly which really helped. She explained everything in detail. This office is very thorough, professional, and empathetic. Definitely recommend to anyone needing dental work!!! I will never go anywhere else for my dental needs!

resp.text: I'm happy the team took great care of you, Cassandra. I hope you continue to have 5-star visits in the future! Keep smiling. - Mitch, ADMI

name: Vonda Moore
text: Worse dental facility ever. I started off with a really good hygienist and turns out she was the only professional there. I got a root canal and they acted like I was a car on an assembly line and same with my wisdom teeth. You’ll have to look up information on the internet to get real after care instructions because they don’t care. I can’t even count the cancellations. I took off work for a cleaning and guess what? Another cancellation. I don’t understand how they still have customers. I was as patient as I possibly could be.

resp.text: I'm sorry your experience didn't live up to expectations, Vonda. If you would like to share more detail about your visit, the Patient Satisfaction team would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Mitch, ADMI

name: brooke gilliland
text: I love this place! Everyone is so caring and goes above and beyond to help patients needs. Dr. Kyatt and Dr. Moore are wonderful doctors! I would definitely recommend to my friends and family!!

resp.text: It's a joy to hear this, Brooke. I'm glad you've had wonderful experiences with the team and I hope you enjoy your future visits just as much! - Krista, ADMI

name: kevin camp
text: Called with tooth pain.  Talked to a very nice gentleman who got me an appointment in the town I was going THE NEXT DAY!  Everyone from the receptionist at the front desk forward during my visit were EXTREMELY NICE!  Got my teeth cleaned and a filling done THAT DAY!  WILL BE RECOMMENDING THEM AND USING THEM GOING FORWARD!!😊😊😊

resp.text: I'm happy to hear that, Kevin. It’s great that you felt at ease with the team, and I hope that you continue to have 5-star experiences. - Cindy, ADMI

name: Melissa Simmons
text:
If I could  rat this dentist a zero I would I am so horrified at the experience I have had at this place about a month ago I went in and had a root canal done and paid cash money to have it done fast forward to now I called them Tuesday and told them that I was having severe pain in that tooth and I need to see the dentist the lady at the front desk told me that I will have to see the Dentist that perform the root canal this is also the lady that try to charge me $150 for a toothbrush  When I went in to get my teeth clean and asked her why it was so much and she said this is how much we charge for a cleaning and found out later that she had added that $150 on my bill for A toothbrush she know I didn’t  want ((((scam)))the only available dates that they whole have will be next Tuesday I explain to her the severe pain that I was having and that I could not wait till next Tuesday because I didn’t know if it had became infected or what was going on she say I’m sorry but you have to wait till that day To me this is gross negligence I do not understand for the life of me why they could not let the dentist that is on call  look at it to tell me what is going on and why I am having such severe pain it is now Saturday and I am not even able to get out of bed because it hurt so bad it is making my head hurt and the side of my face hurt it has turned black around my tooth I am unable to eat or drink anything  and the sad part about it is it not even hurt this bad before I got the root canal and I paid all that money to fix a problem that is now not even fixed!!!!!!!!  And now I am going to have to pay out more money because I am going to the ER to try to figure out what is going on because I am in so much pain !!!!!!!!! I would like a full refund so I can go to a Dentist that actually cares and don’t just push you out the door after they have gotten your money!!!!!!!! I do not trust this place and I refuse to pay them another dime out of my pocket!!!!!! This needs to be fixed and it needs to be fixed now!!!!!

Update I am now running a high fever on my way to the ER!!!!!!!!!

name: Xavier Cortez
text: The staff was very nice and helpful.  I found the visit was comforting , considering the reason for the visit. The doctor was very good at what he does.  I was given antibiotics for a week before he can remove the molar,  cost was $202.00 to remove the molar.  The initial visit and exray was free of charge. I would definitely recommend Aspen Dental of Gadsden to my friends

resp.text: I'm glad that you felt at ease with the team, Xavier. Thanks so much for sharing that you had a 5-star experience at the Aspen Dental practice in Gadsden. - Emily, ADMI

text: I had an appointment scheduled for tomorrow. Got a call this morning telling me they do not accept my insurance!! The Doctor not the company!! Then put that on your website!!!!

name: Becky Dennis
text: I was told when I went for my exam and x-rays that I would come in for my first initial visit to have my extractions done and at that time I would receive my temporary dentures. Then after 6 to 12 months I would come back to get my permanent dentures which never happened. I have called several times with no luck and was even hung up on. My temporary dentures have broken 15 times I had sores in my mouth from them .I didn't even get the ones I picked out

resp.text: I am so sorry Becky; this was not the experience we want for our patients. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, they would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Mitch, ADMI

name: Jack Spivey
text: We recently made an appointment with this business… in Oxford.. for Saturday.. at 8 am.. we  were there  at 745 as we were asked to be… the place wasn’t even open…and today the following Monday I called and they informed me that the appointment had passed… LIKE DUHHHHH !!! I don’t appreciate being done this away… they said the appointment was on Saturday… again..DUHHHH !!!.. this is no way to run a business… I texted the business while we were waiting…. Again.. “zip “… I am posting this to keep a opera on from wasting their time on a business that does people this way… …

resp.text: I'm sorry your experience didn't live up to expectations, Jack. If you would like to share more detail about this, the Patient Satisfaction team would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Mitch, ADMI

text: Great staff and quick to get you in and out.

resp.text: I'm glad you had a quick and efficient experience, Christopher. Thanks for sharing! - Krista, ADMI

name: Fallon Korsmo
text: Leaving a dentist with a great feeling is sometimes rare. Let me tell you, this place it the best! From the front desk, X-rays, cleaning, doctor visit and payment/ checkout ... everyone was so wonderful. It’s so tough to visit a workplace where everyone is so happy and friendly not only to each other but to everyone who came through the office!

resp.text: I'm glad you enjoyed your visit, Fallon. Patient satisfaction is very important to Aspen Dental practices, and it's great to hear that the team helped you have a 5-star experience. - Michelle, ADMI

name: Cynthia Short
text: Still bleeding and in pain.  The dentist did a good job and made sure gums were numb before working on teeth.

name: Jerry Cash
text:
I have an abscessed tool, which is painful. I am still waiting on my stimulus check but have enough for the extractions. However, because I would not sign the full treatment plan, the tooth extraction was delayed more than 10 days. I felt that I was not important enough to receive immediate  care. I left believing that they are concerned more about the money than helping me. Now I am searching for another dentist.
Blessings, Jerry

resp.text: I'm very sorry to hear this, Jerry. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, they would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you about your experience: 1-866-767-0890. - Krista, ADMI

text: I love this office. The staff is very professional and helpful. They offer an array of dental plans that would fit any patient needs.

name: randall gregerson
text:
The experience was great in almost every way. The staff and Dr. Kayatt are excellent.
My only complaint is that they do not strictly enforce the mask policy in the waiting room. One man was not only sans mask, but complained to the receptionist about mask policies. I know this seems petty to some when considering it's a dental office, yet, I must say that the location has a mask policy and should enforce it. Otherwise, it was a very good experience for a difficult and anxious procedure.

resp.text: Hi Randall, I'm so glad you've enjoyed your experience with the team. We appreciate your feedback about COVID/mask issue. I will pass this along to the team, but please don't hesitate to reach out to them to discuss any questions or concerns you have about your treatment plan. - Cindy, ADMI

name: Joanie Medlin
text: One star one because I can't give none. This is the biggest joke of a company I have ever seen! I called at 0800 am and made an emergency virtual appointment for my husband who was in severe pain with a broken tooth. His entire face and neck was swollen. They stated that we should receive an email prior the the scheduled time with instructions and if not then to call back. 45 minutes prior to the appointment, no email so I called. Was told that we wouldn't get an email but would get a call at the appointed time. No call. I called them again, they rescheduled for an hour later with a different office. We still did not receive any form of contact. We ended up in the emergency department. I will be reporting this company to the BBB. Absolutely ridiculous to even call this a business!!!

resp.text: I'm sorry that your experience didn't live up to expectations, Joanie, regarding your husbands appointment. If you would like to share more detail about your visit, the team and I would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Cindy, ADMI

name: Joshua Gooch
text: Came in for my initial appointment and staff didn’t want to see me. I ask why and they say, “well your appointment was at 12:00”-look at my phone and it is 12:03! I’m glad they’ve got plenty of patients and don’t need anymore, especially for those Friday afternoons, my family won’t be back.

resp.text: I'm really sorry to hear this, Joshua. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, they would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you about your experience, so they can address concerns directly with the office: 1-866-767-0890. - Krista, ADMI

name: Tunishia Venable
text: I was nerves about going to Aspen dental. I did not know what to expect. They made me an appointment the same day. They were professional. Clean. And helpful. This was one of the best experiences. I would recommend them to anyone.

resp.text: I'm glad you enjoyed your visit, Tunishia. Patient satisfaction is very important to Aspen Dental practices, and it's great to hear that the team helped you have a 5-star experience. - Sue, ADMI

name: Jesse Keith
text: Aspen dental of Gadsden, AL is by far the best dental office I’ve ever visited and had work done The assistants Ashley and Britney are polite and helpful and know their jobs extremely well, the office manager Jaimie and her staff were so nice and made scheduling and payment options so easy without stress and I saved the best for last as the Drs Haight and Kyatt were so gentle and explained everything upfront were patient and thorough as to my options and made the procedure absolutely painless. I strongly suggest visiting Aspen dental for any of your dental issues. There’s not a procedure they can’t accommodate and are remarkable at all of them I’m sure if they’re as good they were with my procedure. Just wanted to give that office credit because I didn’t know it was possible to have a painless visit with this amazing outcome without taking out a loan but they’re actually quite reasonable on their prices too. Still can’t believe it!! Thanks Aspen.  10 stars, two thumbs up whichever, you tell me after your visit 😁💯

resp.text: This is wonderful to hear, Jesse. I'm so glad you felt the Aspen Dental team in Gadsden went above and beyond for you. Thanks for taking a moment to share the details of your exceptional experience! - Krista, ADMI

text:
I was disappointed with the Doctor. She has no person skills.  I resented the fact that she said I just giving you options and you can make the decision was to what you want.

I feel that if you are in this position that you should have good people skills so that you can make the patient feel that they aren't just here for profit only.

text: The dental hygienist was so kind and did a great job. The actual dentist I saw was rude to me and pushy. I don’t appreciate feeling defensive when I’m just trying to visit the dentist. I would rather not see that dentist next time I go to Aspen Dental. Other than that one really rude dentist, the rest of the staff is nice and they do a good job.

name: Dana Hill
text: I went in with low expectations but they were exceeded. There was a slight miscommunication but the office manager I think that she is, fixed it before I left. They were able to make the dental work that I severely needed fit in to the amount my insurance would approve. I didn’t have much of a wait time which was awesome and even after the consultation and X-rays they were able to get me in the same day for the cleaning and impressions. The dentist and dental hygienist was nice and not judgy considering the train wreck of teeth I was needing help with. I am thankful for them. Believe me!

resp.text: I'm glad you enjoyed your visit, Dana. Patient satisfaction is very important to Aspen Dental practices, and it's great to hear that the team helped you have a 5-star experience. - Dawn, ADMI

name: Britnn Devoll
text:
Refuse to give a cleaning unless I pay $130 per tooth (x32) for medicine they claim I HAVE to have. $4700 for a deep clean. Refuse to do a normal deep clean. Also snuck in $135 out of pocket charge for an Electric Toothbrush when I already told them I had an expensive one.

People were pleasant. But my Lord at the cost. $9500 total and that's not even talking braces or anything that I do need.

I just don't believe any healthcare provider can be at a point where you HAVE to have certain things done you can't elect for the services you need. Basically said I had to do all or nothing.

resp.text: I'm sorry that the experience didn't live up to expectations. If you have any questions about the care plan you received, please don't hesitate to reach out to the team. – Dawn, ADMI

name: Lisa Cornelison
text: I made my appointment specifically saying I was in severe pain and wanted the tooth pulled. The day of my appointment they called 3 hours early asking me to come on in because they had so many cancellations. Great..no.. I get there and after 2 hours of being there ( with supposedly all other appointments cancelled) the dentist comes in (finally) apologizes for taking so long and then continues to tell me to make an appointment to come back because she didn't have time to pull it!! Why have me come in early and then still not do what i came for?? On top of that the next available appointment to come back was a week away..thanks but no thanks I happily found another dentist that got me straight in and the tooth pulled.

name: Vicky King
text: Only giving one star so I can post this review. I made my appointment yesterday and explained what I was needing done. I was given an appointment for 10 this morning I got there early and did paperwork. I waited an hour before I was taken back for my quote consultation. At this time I was informed that the advertising I had saw would not be available and it would be $338.00 for what was advertised at $50.00.  The girl doing the consultation didn't seem to care about my time or the fact that a national advertising price existed. She said the doctor made the price.  You would think it should be the same no matter what aspen you go to guess not. I called the corporate office and spoke with a customer satisfaction specialist guess we'll see what they say. The reviews about pricing all are true at this location.

name: Angie Anini
text: The dentist and associates where very nice the only probably I had was the copay for anesthesia $600 and they wanted it all before surgery and I'm on disability I ask could I make small payments and I couldn't which is hard on somebody on disability.Other than working with me on that they was great.

resp.text: I'm happy to hear that, Angie. Thanks for sharing! - Dawn, ADMI

name: Cheryl Laney
text: Went for bad tooth pain. Tooth needs to be pulled. I take blood thinners so  I cannot take Iboprofren.The dentist wrote antibiotics and told me to take Iboprofren.for my pain.Told her I can't so can I get something for my tooth pain.she said no nothing we can do. First time in my life ever been treated like that .I have had several bad teeth thru the years pulled  she is the only dentist that ever didn't prescribe meds for my pain until antibiotic could take affect.she said in about three days it feel better.Three days is lot  of hurting considering all my days before this. I will not come back.

resp.text: I'm sorry that your experience didn't live up to expectations. We value your feedback, and I will pass your message along to the team so they can address concerns. - Michelle, ADMI

text: Had a tooth pulled and I'm still having trouble and NO ONE will return my call

text: They were great and nice

name: Sarah Payne
text: Long wait time. After I was called back, I was put into another waiting room for another hour. X-rays was another wait. The dentist even said the woman taking the pictures should have been able to do it better. I was told there wouldn't be a fee because of my dental coverage then they tell me it'll be 50 dollars before my cleaning. I ask "for what?" And they reply fluoride and toothpaste. I've never been charged for fluoride at any other dentist office and a fee for toothpaste? I said that I didn't want either then. Then the clerk says she has to go ask the dentist if I don't have to purchase toothpaste. Thankfully she says they said it was fine if I didn't. Got my cleaning, then left. Will not be back.

name: Rayliene Hutchens
text: Fast, informative, kind and caring.  They verified my insurance coverage and we made a dental plan to meet my needs and budget.  Other family members told me the Aspen folks were great and they were absolutely spot on!  Thanks Gadsden AL team members.

resp.text: I'm happy to hear this, Rayliene. It’s so great to hear this about the team, and I hope that you continue to have 5-star experiences. — Dawn, ADMI

name: Bianca Hernandez
text: Made an appointment mid June and later got a call saying it had to be rescheduled due to the dentist having an emergency. Rescheduled for July 15th at 4 pm . I called twice in the same week prior to my appointment to confirm my date and time. Came in at 3:50 and lady at front desk walks to the back and comes back about 5-6 mins later, saying they are booked and she doesn't know what happened in system. Does not sound legitimate to me. I do not recommend.

text: Just don't do it! Seriously! The office is dazzling and the people may be nice enough, but their company policies are for the birds. They give you a quote for services to be rendered and say what we quote is what you pay...but then you get billed for "things insurance didn't cover" just to see if they can get more money out of you. If you call them on it, you don't have to pay and they will write it off. The whole operation is just shady.

text: I used the Aspen dental in Gadsden Alabama.  They were so nice and explained the cheapest to most expensive and they take my insurance so I'll be able to start right away at the beginning of the month.  Very exited

name: Tate Nance
text: Don't recommend at all. They care more about their "consultations" where they try to pressure you into buying completely unnecessary stuff, such as a $150+ toothbrush, than providing intimate dental care. The "dentist" does more sales pitches than actual dental work. Not to mention she isn't very friendly. Aspen just wants to drain your wallet. Find a family-owned, local practice instead of these corporate salesmen.

resp.text:
I'm sorry you didn’t have a positive experience, Tate. Patient satisfaction is very important to Aspen Dental practices, and I would really appreciate the opportunity to speak with you. If you would like, you can call me directly at
844-296-0187 EXT 201152. - Julie, ADMI

name: Danette Wilson
text: I went yesterday for my first root canal. I was very nervous . The staff, and especially Dr. May, put me at ease, talked to me, and explained everything in detail.  When she told me she was finished,  i couldn't believe it! It was so simple and painless. I had no pain, and woke up today not even feeling discomfort. I recommend Dr. May and Aspen Dental to everyone, especially those who struggle with anxiety at the dentist,  like me!

resp.text: Thank you for sharing,! I’m so glad that you felt comfortable with the team, and I hope that you find it easier to continue letting us help with your dental needs.  — Dawn, ADMI

name: Brooke Copeland
text: first of all we were there for four hours it was our first visit and was just an initial visit. After my daughter was taken back she was treated rude and talk to you like she was nothing. That would ask her a question and interrupt her in the middle of her trying to answer it. But back to the dentist as far as they go I believe this is where all the title loans and the Advance Cash payment check stores have went to. My daughter's teeth are fine she needed a cleaning and 1 filling before she was getting her braces put on and instead of going to our normal dentist we decided to just get it done faster and go to Aspen Dental. Worst mistake ever all they want is money money money. My daughter's teeth are fine she brushes twice a day she goes to the dentist on a regular basis. They told her she had gum disease and needed to have a gum debrilement before she could even have a cleaning done. It was going to cost us $1,400 And we have the best dental insurance you can get. We get free cleanings and free X-rays and free fillings it's good insurance. These people are quacks and are money hungry and all they want is to charge you for stuff you don't need.

name: Emmalee Keef
text: I got text from this office on 12/27/19 that my appointment was at 10:00 I live 45 minutes away from Gadsden. We drove all the way down here to see a paper on the door that says they are closed. Which also we had a appointment to fix the problem yesterday and they didn’t fix the problem with a hour and a half long visit.

name: Lea Johnson
text: I had the best experience ever! They were so amazing! I had an appointment for Monday the 10th, but came in because I was experiencing TERRIBLE tooth pain. They fit me right in and Dr. Singh made sure I was completely comfortable before my procedure and wouldn't let me leave until I wasn't in pain anymore! He explained the procedure in detail and was very helpful! Very gentle dentist! The staff was very helpful and patient. They stayed an hour over closing time to give my root canal. I love Aspen Dental of Gadsden and will continue to go there!

resp.text: It's so nice to hear that, Lea. I'm glad the team helped you have a 5-star experience, and I hope you enjoy your future visits just as much. The office will be so happy to read this.  — Kelly, ADMI

name: Cassie Rhodes
text: This is one of the best dentist offices that I have been to. If you don't have lots of money, no worries. They will work with you and allow you to make payments. Jamie, the lady who handles the financial part of the business is a sweetheart. She was so thorough and patient with me and all my questions. I learned that I am in the early stages of periodontal disease. The dental hygienist, Renae, worked through her lunch break to perform a periodontal treatment on me because I told her it was VERY important that I had it done before the next week. The dentist, listen, you will read reviews saying that she's rude, etc. My goodness, here in the south we tend to be big babies. She isn't rude, at all. She's just very professional and straight to the point. I am sure that she never intended to come across as rude to anyone that's just how she may seem but NOT rude, by any means. I, also, read a lot of reviews where people complained that they tried to force them to buy a toothbrush or only cared to make money. I have a feeling that all of these people, unfortunately, misunderstood a lot. They, too, told me about a certain type of toothbrush and gave me a pamphlet on it. There is nothing wrong with feeling strongly about a toothbrush. Electric toothbrushes clean your teeth and gums far more thoroughly than one that is not. I am sure that the dental hygenist, who recommended the toothbrush to me, doesn't pocket a dime for the people who purchase the toothbrushes. Please don't be misinformed or mislead by other reviews. Give them a try. I am recommending them to you, just like they were recommended to me by a coworker. I will be going back to Aspen Dental! :-)

resp.text: I'm so glad the team helped you have a positive experience, Cassie. I hope you enjoy future visits just as much. - Julie, ADMI

name: Patrick Brown
text:
As soon as I walked in this newer facility, the employees from the front desk attendant to the young lady who did the X-rays made me feel welcomed and glad I made the decision to come there. Ms. Catherine took her time to study my films and make out a plan that would benefit me the most for my dental health.
From Courtney to the district manager they all made me feel at ease.
I have to go back and comment to the X-ray girl. She had a very jovial disposition and had a very professional attitude while making my visit welcoming.
They set up a working plan to correct my issues while taking my time into consideration which is always a big plus to a working person.
In closing, I would recommend Aspen to anyone looking for a dentist and a place that makes you feel at ease and important as well

resp.text: That's so nice to hear, Patrick. It’s great that you felt at ease with the team, and I hope that you continue to have 5-star experiences. - Emily, ADMI

name: Kym Maxwell
text: EVERY member of the staff from the dental assistant to the dentist to the office manager were amazing. I have EXTREME anxiety about the dentist, and they could tell, so they did everything they could to help put me at ease. There was one worker named Sonya and she was ABSOLUTELY wonderful, she was so kind and went above her duty to calm me down. I would HIGHLY recommend Aspen Dental to anyone.

name: Crystal “Nashea” Rolen
text: Very great, friendly, detailed on what they are going to do and will work with you on paying them. I love them!!

text: I went to my appointment in pain. I left my appointment in pain. They did NOTHING for my pain nor did they do anything for my infected tooth. Not even a prescription.

Right Now I can't give any Higher.

It's Just That I Am SCARED TO DEATH of DENTIST. 👹👹👹👹 And the thought of Having All MY teeth pulled at Once is KILLING ME!! 😖😖😖  Please say a Prayer I will get through this and I Promise I Will Let You All Know How it Went and Goes.

name: Marty Jacobs
text: My experience here at Aspen dental was as pleasant as any dentist appt could be. The entire staff is friendly, informative, and not the least bit judgmental.  Everyone made me feel comfortable despite my anxiety, and I would highly recommend them (and have already) to my friends and family. Also the costs are significantly lower than other places I've checked especially without insurance, and they are more than willing to help you in any way possible.  I actually can't wait to go back!

resp.text: It makes me so happy to hear that, Martha. I'm glad you felt at ease with the team, and I hope that you continue to have positive experiences. - Emily, ADMI

name: David Dixon
text: I went as a new patient. I was in pain from a broken tooth. They got me in on the day after I called. I did sit in waiting room for an hour on an 7:15 appointment time, but at least they got me in. They did a complete X-ray and tooth evaluation on all of my teeth. I left there still in pain, but with some scripts for meds to help with the pain. I have another appointment for next week. I hope it doesn’t hurt until then. Thanks for getting me in on short notice as a new patient.

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to let us know, David! We’ll be sure to pass this along. — Dawn, ADMI

name: michelle Dozier
text: If I could leave NO stars I would.  I visited this location about a year and a half ago and everything was fine.  Had initial appointment where they did Xrays and evaluation and then had four teeth pulled the next day.  Was way overcharged compared to other dentists in the area, but because they were able to extend a credit line I paid the over priced services for relief from tooth pain with little money out of pocket.  Fast forward to today.  I have severe tooth pain that has had me away all night. I called at 7:30 this morning and the lady that took my call offered me appointments starting at 7:45 (which was the earliest appointment and I took it), and then just about every 15 mins increments after that for the rest of the day.  When we got to my name and information, she stated I was already in their system and would need to call back when the office opened to schedule my appointment.  I just called to schedule the appointment and they can not see me until late afternoon. I asked the lady could they not see me this morning, that I was in a lot of pain and had been up all night and she said no, that 2:30 was the earliest they could see me.  So I questioned why "new" patients could be seen as early as 7:45 am and every 15 mins forward, and walk in patients as their website says, can be seen this morning, but existing patients who have already spent a LOT of money with them are not able to be seen until later in the day.  She had no answer other then that is the earliest I could be seen.  Not to mention, even though it has only been a year and a half, I have to do all the exam and Xrays all over again just like a new patient, would not be treated that day for what was hurting and  would have to schedule another appointment to have any work done after the initial appointment.  So this place wants to charge me to complete new patient services, however does not want to give me new patient scheduling times.  I was willing to pay their ridiculous costs because I still have $3000 in credit with their finance company, but I refuse to sit her in pain all day while they schedule new patients in front of me............   Terrible, awful and ungrateful staff and services. Will not recommend and will advise everyone I know against them.

resp.text: I certainly understand your frustration. Please call me at (844) 296-0187 ext. 201706, so I can assist you with this — Dawn, ADMI

name: Jessica Harp
text: My visit was pleasant and more informative than any other dentist's office has been. I've had some horrible experiences with other dental offices and Aspen Dental is the dental office that is now repairing and fixing the horrible dental work I've received in my past. My first visit I received more xrays and examination than I've ever received elsewhere. They are very thorough and take the time to explain all of your options to you. The lady dentist I spoke with was so helpful in helping me make the right choice for the dental work that I need to have done.

resp.text: Thank you, Jessica, for sharing this outstanding informaton! I will be sure to pass it along! Tammy ADMI

name: Kaci Watts
text: My visit here was nothing short of uncomfortable and unprofessional. I arrived early for my appointment with my new patient paperwork, dental insurance card and valid I.D. in hand when I arrived. My appointment was scheduled for 7 a.m. and I was not called back until 7:40. After my exam the office manager told me they wouldn't be able to clean my teeth that day that I'd have to reschedule after my appointment was for a cleaning. Fast forward to the check out process and the office manager informed me for 2 fillings and a cleaning would cost me $370.00 (this is with my dental insurance) well turns out the only thing I would actually owe would be right at $60.00!!!! They tried charging me $135 for a toothbrush and $52.00  cancer screening I never even asked for! Very rude and inconsiderate of your time!!

name: Mary Harper
text: This is the worse dental place I have ever been to.. You get over charged for everything. I looked at the papers they have me and they charged me 3 and 4 times for the same thing, then told me that the teeth cleaning is charged for each quadrant of my teeth. This was never explained to me and I have never been to a dentist that charged that way, they did the same thing that other dentist do, and charged me for each quadrant of my teeth, said I had a gum disease, my gums are pushed up over my enamel on my teeth caused from me over brushing them, and brushing them the wrong way,, I did this when I was a child and brushed my teeth 8 to 10 times a day, because my Mom's teeth were so bad and I have seen her in so much pain from bad teeth, so I was over brushing my teeth. I was told that everything would be charged through Genesis Credit, I got a card from the credit company and never activated it... But they don't tell you that the charges are for your first visit only.. Then get the bill and for the few things they did my bill was $1013 and some change.. I went to only get a filling done on a tooth and the dentist was drilling out my tooth that needed filled and kept bouncing off my tooth he was drilling on and kept bouncing off my tooth and hitting a tooth behind the one he was working on, so now I have the tooth he kept hitting with the drill that has to be filled.. I was suppose to go back to get my 2nd cleaning and I was told I would have to pay them in cash for it, then found out that it had already been charged on the credit company, so there they thought they were going to get paid twice,, so Aspen Dental was going to make you pay 2 times for the same thing, as they did on my bill... I was told that the special mouth rinse and special toothpaste was included with the Oral B toothbrush kit, and looked on my papers and was charged 3 and 4 times each for the mouth rinse and toothpaste.. This is the worse dental place I have ever been to... And I have called the Customers Care line and am told they would have someone call me by tomorrow, I have been told this for several times, and the ones that call me tell me to call back if they haven't called me within 2 days, to call them back.. I have been calling them since right after I had my dental appointment and got the paperwork on all the charges and I almost fell over,, I was lied to by the employees, the dentist, and customer care... This is ridiculous... Aspen Dental is a ripoff.. Everyone I have talked to that has been there has nothing good to say about Aspen Dental in Gadsden Alabama.. I have tried to get this straighten out about being overcharged on what was done, and am always told if you don't hear back from me in 2 days, to call back, I have been doing this for months, and they have done nothing to resolve this problem... So my advice to everyone that is bringing about going to Aaron Dental in Gadsden Alabama DON'T USE THEM, THEY ARE CROOKS!!!!!!!...This is the sorriest place I have ever been to... I'm trying to get this straighten out or I'm going to turn them in to the Better Business Bureau, and see if they can do something about them!!!!!!

text: I made an appointment for getting cosmetic dental work done,  which would be a cash transaction.  On the day of the appointment,  I received a text saying that the appointment was canceled. I was told that  they had been too short staffed the day before and had had to close the office because of it. A new appointment was made for the following week.  Day of the appointment,  same thing happened,  only this time in addition to not enough staff, the dentist also did not show. What kind of business is this? I'm sitting here with cash business and can't get seen. This is a bad sign for me; i am taking my business elsewhere

name: Konnie Taylor
text: Came in knowing I had several cavities that would need to be filled. Was seen fairly quickly and the cavities confirmed but told I have an infection that needs to be treated before the fillings. Left with an estimate but no antibiotics, cleaning or fillings. resp.text: I certainly understand your frustration Konnie. I am sorry the team did not address your concern and should have explained our new patient visit. name: Darlene Harcrow
text: The staff was GREAT, BUT the price was ASTRONOMICAL!!!!  The price I was quoted with my insurance was $6400 and that was without a partial.  I went to another local dentist in the area and with the price of a partial with my insurance, my out of pocket cost is $710. Apple to Apple comparison,  The only thing different was the local dentist was only pulling one wisdom tooth and repairing one of the other ones, the other 2 were perfectly fine with no cavities, but Aspen wanted to pull them all.  And Aspen quoted doing an entire deep clean on my mouth with 21 day round of permanent antibiotics in my gum, NOT, and the other dentist said it looked like only one quadrant may need to be deep cleaned but that because of a bad tooth in that quadrant, you could get a false reading, so we needed to pull that one and then access the deep cleaning at my next cleaning.  Was told by the local dentist that my teeth were in good condition just needed some cavities filled and 2 teeth pulled.    So great staff or not, the money difference is not worth the visit.

text: Just want to start by saying these people only want your money. This facility is very new and clearly they need to meet there quota to pay it off. Staff is very nice but when it comes to experience and knowing what they are doing, the lack all of the above. Went to have a simple cleaning and they tell me I have a gum disease. Ok, fair enough I use to smoke so it happens. So I proceed to allow them to do the procedure but wait first I had to pay $180 before I could have any treatment which to my understanding was suppose to cover everything and my insurance cover the rest. Then we go on. They say one of my back teeth js decaying and needs to be uprooted. I allow it to happen because I had bothered me for years. In the most of pulling the tooth the dentist breaks the bone off that holds the tooth in process of pulling it. I told him multiple times before pulling it that I would soon be getting braces and I didn't want that to affect it. Well now that has caused issue with getting braces. So on, I have cavities. A total different dentist is doing this procedure days later. He and the women helping carried on the whole time and was more focused on there conversation than fixing my Cavaties. That being said he didn't fill the tooth the complete way so now I have sensitivity for sweet hot and cold things. The other day I get a bill from them. $172 it was. Going back to the gym disease. I had to "pay everything up front" before I could have the procedure done right. At least that's what the lady said. I just got off the phone with them. They begin to tell me the bill is only $126.??? So why did I get billed $50 more than that. Or better question why am I even being billed period when I supposedly had to pay everything that my insurance didn't cover up front.??? Absolute worst experience and place to go. Don't waste your time or your money.

resp.text: Hi Samantha, I'm so sorry to hear this. I encourage you to let the Patient Satisfaction team at 1-866-273-8606 know about your experience so they can address concerns. If unresolved, they can also help with billing issues. - Emily, ADMI

name: Cynthia Pearman
text: First, let me say that my situation was dire due to extreme pain.  It is important to me to let people know how wonderful this experience was, and how much I appreciate the "care" involved with each step of the way.  Dr. Hirsowitz(Tuscaloosa) is amazing!!  His examination was thorough and he was quick to put together a care plan that was in my best interest and financially affordable.  In addition, I was also seen by Dr. Rotwein (Trussville) whom won my overall admiration for doing one thing no doctor has ever done. Dr. Rotwein personally called me to make sure that I was doing okay after surgery.  In my world, this was just unheard of and I was just floored.  This told me he truly cared for all of his patients and that is a breath of fresh air.   Everyone at both locations office, financial, and medical staff were just amazing!   Do not hesitate to choose Aspen Dental for your dental needs.

resp.text: Cynthia, we love hearing from our patients, especially such kind words. We appreciate you and thank you for your support, welcome to the Aspen family. – Cindy ADMI

name: Janie Martin
text: I needed extensive dental work. I had basically neglected getting my annual dental care at the dentist over the past few years. As a single parent of two girls, I took a lot of leave from my job, when I was working, to make sure my children received good dental heath care. I really couldn't afford to take the same kind of leave to care for my own teeth, since I was taking the majority of my sick leave to attend to my health, and other needs for my children. Also, dealing with health problems like multiple auto immune diseases, unknowingly didn't help my teeth, or my situation. My illness took a toll on my teeth. Within the last couple of years, my teeth began to deteriorate at an alarming rate. I knew l needed to take immediate action once I retired,  because I would be eating, and my tooth would actually crumble in my mouth, as I was chewing my food. Moreover, they began to cause me excruciating pain, especially late at night, when I couldn't seek immediate attention, so I began my journey to having a healthy smile. First, I asked friends and family about their dental experiences. I was given several dentist names, and referrals. I narrowed it down to three of the best ones, that I heard the most positive experiences about. Then, I began searching the internet for reviews about the three dental offices. Affordable dentures in Mccalla, was one of the three, that I had heard consistent positive experiences about from family and friends. Surprisingly, they had some of the best reviews, that I had seen. The reviews matched the responses, that I had heard. The wow factor for me was that, the responses were  consistent by a majority of the reviewers. Most of the reviewers stated that, Dr. Latimer was professional, caring, thorough,  knowledgeable, he lessened my fears of anxiety,  he made me feel comfortable, he answered all of my questions and concerns,  it was the best dental experience ever, and I'll definitely be back. Well! I'm not reading a review, I was a patient, and these are my exact sentiments. I made the decision and picked Affordable dentures in Mccalla. Sooooo glad I did!!! I arrived for my full upper extractions, and some lower extractions on June 5, 2020. I was apprehensive, had a lot of anxiety, and nervous to say the least! In my previous dental experiences in the past, I went to the dental  office for a dental procedure, extractions, and because I was in pain. I remember experiencing pain during the procedure, leaving, and being in worse pain, than when I initially came to the dentist. Upon arriving at my appointment at Affordable dentures for my procedure, I was immediately led to the dental room, given a sedative, and instucted to lye down on the dental couch. While on the couch, I received some gas as I waited for Dr. Latimer. The first time he checked on me, " I told him that the medicine probably wasn't going to affect me much, since I take a lot of pain medication, sleep aids, and other medicines for my health conditions, that are mostly ineffective. He waited a while, and checked on me again, I said, "I told you, I have a high tolerance for medications." The third time, I was being awakened to go home.. Stop! thinking about it, and procrastinating,  and like Nike, "Just do it!" Thanks to Dr. Latimer, and his entire staff. I truly appreciate the great care, concern, and service that I received..

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing, Janie!

name: W Meyers
text:
Very friendly staff and the doctor and assistant are very professional made me feel very comfortable

This is my second post about Affordable Dentures. I have had alot of work on my teeth. The staff has been nothing but great and I'm very happy with the work they have done. They treat you like family and are very professional.

text: They actually LISTENED to what I wanted!!!  I got a great set of dentures that FIT at a great price.  The friendly, yet professional staff made it a stress free, enjoyable experience.

name: Heather Sellers
text: This staff is awesome! I brought my mom here for dentures and they were so gentle with her. My mom said the reason she wanted to come to this location is because when she was calling around the receptionist was the nicest and most patient person she talked to out of all the places she called, and she took the time to answer all of her questions. The morning we came I had an unexpected health incident and they even took great care of me. The nurse brought me back to a room, checked all my vitals and my blood sugar, and got me some cold water. The dentist even came in and checked on me. And I wasn't even their patient!! It did not matter because they just saw my mom's concern and wanted to make sure I was ok. The dentures I purchased for my mom really were affordable and there were no hidden fees or additional costs; we paid exactly what they said we would on the phone. The dentures were ready that same day. My mom has been back once since her original appointment for a slight adjustment and she said they were just as nice. I would recommend this office to anyone!

name: Edna Conyersdouglas
text:
One year ago I had an upper denture made and fitted at Affordable Dentures in McCalla, AL.  At that time, I took my old denture in for reference, though it was broken in half.  I paid over $800 which included a 4 year warranty for the replacement denture that they made.  Though I no longer live near this affordable denture location, I felt getting the crack repaired would be simpler if I drove the 2 hours to the office from which I originally received service.
The office had no familiar faces, not receptionist or dentists or hygienists.  I left my home at 6am and after fighting morning traffic, I made it there in 2 hours and 15 minutes.
I was told that I needed to update my file, so I filled out 3 pages of information. When I was called back, I told the not so amicable hygienist why I was there.  She examined the denture, saw the crack and then asked me where I had it made.  I responded, "Here." She then excused herself and came back to tell me they could repair the denture but I would have to return at 2pm.
At 2pm I was called back to see the repair and to be fitted.  There was grit of some kind on the denture which made it rough.  I told the hygienist this and she said she could polish it, if I'd like.  She and the dentist returned with the denture grittier than before.  The bite was totally off, the gum of the denture met my bottom teeth when chewing. I complained to no avail.  I felt as if I was a hindrance in their day.  If appearance is all affordable dentures and you  care about, then I would say go.  If follow-up service and useful teeth are concerns, you might want to think twice.
I am 72 years old and for the 5 to 6 hours I spent on the road and for the service I got and the gritty denture I still have, I think 2 stars is being quite generous.

text: The staff was extremely kind and answered any question i had. They made sure I was as comfortable as possible and I will admit that it was pretty painless. I would recommend. affordable dentures in MaCalla to anyone who is terrified of dentist to give them a chance. You won't regret it.

text: Scheduled five days ahead of my appointment for an extraction.price was quoted and everything.get there to the back and wait over an hour for them to say they "dont have time" to do my extraction. Basically they were overbooked and short staffed. I had to leave in pain. Lucky me, I had made a backup appointment with another dentist for that next day but I will NEVER go here again!!! Period!!!

name: Chad Tillison
text: I sat there for 2 1/2 hours the doctor never looked at me.he saw 7 other patients that came in after me.it took an hour to get me back done an x ray.tyen sat in a chair for 2 1/2 hours. I walked out and left I figured if they are already treating me bad imagine how awful they would be if the dentist actually came and look at my mouth. And here's another thing I have an extreme phobia against dentist.it took me days to work up the nerve to go,and I told them that when I go there that I just want to get my work done and get out that sitting makes me anxious.basically this place if full of low down people.its all about the money I'm guessing. I will never return here and I hope they get what's deserved to them for how they treat people!

name: Melissa Marshall
text: I love Dr Kellum he was very kind and worked diligently for me to give me the best smile possible. His staff was very knowledgeable and very helpful. I would recommend this place to ANYONE.

name: Jonathan T
text: I made my appointment a few days prior to my visit. It was obvious I was dealing with a call center out of state. I told her I needed a reline and she gave me the appointment. When I showed up I was told that they don’t file insurance and you have to do it yourself so you have to pay full price the day of and then wait for reimbursement later after you’ve filled out and sent in the paperwork. And I mentioned insurance to the person making the appointment and she didn’t tell me about how they handle insurance. The receptionist told me they don’t do relines on dentures they didn’t make but she told me to wait and see what the dentist said. I waited over an hour. It was obvious that appointments weren’t really set in stone because the waiting room was packed. After waiting over an hour I was told immediately in the room that they couldn’t do anything unless I got new dentures. I told her I didn’t need new ones and that was it. I was obviously told to wait all of that time in hopes they might upsell me into another option. It seems they only care about money and there’s no personal touch. I wouldn’t recommend anyone go there when there are so many local dentists that will treat you like a person. I made an appointment with a real dentist across the street when I left. Don’t waste your time with this place.

name: Barbara Kirkland
text:
I have worn dentures for 30 plus years.  I Ihave spent ten tbousands for four uppers, four lowers and one full set. I never was able to eat or keep any of the lowers dentures in because of either pain or discomfort.  I was told that  I could expect this  because  of my thin gums and jaw structure.  My only  hope was to get plants. Because of the expense of implants  that was not an option for me.  I heard through word of mouth  and even saw beautiful work Affordable Dentures  had performed on clients. Still I did  not believe they could do me any justice. I visited their office in Mc Calla. Everyone was so cordial and helpful.  I was still unsure whether to
trust them because of what I had experienced or been told.  I called or else went to visit about
ten other agencies. I did  not receive the same
caring treatment.  I went back to Affordable Dentures. The  staff did experience some challenges  but they  assured  me they would work hard  to deliver me an excellent product.
Once I received  my dentures. I left  their office
feeling great so great  I was  able to eat like the dentures was  my natural  teeth. I had them  a couple of weeks  now and I am amaze of such comfort.

text: What a relief!  State of the art dental practice in South Baldwin County, Bay Dental on U. S  Highway 98 is distinguished by brand new equipment and furnishings as well as a bright attitude towards good work and in good hands. text: We are so thankful to have found Dr. Avery! They were prompt and flexible with scheduling to get my entire family in quickly. My three children and I had the most amazing and pain free experiences and can’t wait to return. Even my 9 year old was amazed that she felt “nothing” when having a tooth extracted!  They were compassionate and attentive towards her throughout the entire process. It is clear that we are in capable and experienced hands there. A HUGE bonus is the sweet therapy dog, Cappie!  He’s the absolute best and deserves his own 5* review! Thanks Fairhope Bay Dental!

text: The best place you ever. Nice staff, pleasant,  respectful,  and makes you feel like you're the mist important person there.

name: Jeffery Wynn
text:
We initially had a good  experience with DMD Kym. The visit was to determine what we needed to do with me 71 year old Fabulous Mom. 😉 The office  was patient  and helped us get a bottom denture made and CREATED A PLAN  to work on the top after the bottom  was completed. Now Mom's on hospice care at home
along with the influx of Covid 19, we had to cancel many appointments.  Well  all the "planets were in alignment today" and I actually got her in to get  the denture. Mr. Kym spoke extremely curtly to her and quite frankly. Afterwards quickly , what I felt to dismiss us. Mr. Kym actually wait for it...........sent us home with this  denture only.
Nothing  else. So fast forward as Iam looking at it sitting on my table "on a napkin"  I called the office to inquire as to how to care for it. What to put it in (other than her mouth of course) And remembered her telling him that a tooth on top was sharp and causing pain to her tongue. To which he offered NO assistance. Pretty Inept  is the opinion I have of this guys practice.  He also made it quite clear he would offer no  further assistance with her remaining denture situation. You remember, the " plan" he had established prior. At any rate  I am simply at a loss.  Mr. Kym, Kim whatever at the very least owes her an apology for the lack of respect that he obviously felt was OK to show towardmy Mom. And at this point,  perhaps he could have one of his assistants  forward His  initial  " plan " if you will,  to a DMD whom can assist us in finishing her needs? I have reached out to Medicare and UHC for any assistance, thoughts or recommendations.

name: Paul Collins
text: Nice people great experience

Everyone is so compassionate and caring. I am

name: Kat Calvert
text: From the front desk to the dentist, this is a wonderful office. The assistants are knowledge, kind & extremely professional. Dr. Tan showed such a degree of professionalism and compassion. I have never received such great dental care in my life. Will and have recommended to everyone. Such a blessing to me.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words.  We appreciate your positive review.

name: Aaron G
text:
I’ve been to this office twice . After my first visit I felt something was off about the way they handle things but I thought maybe I was overthinking it so I decided to go to my second appointment .

During my first appointment I just needed to get a diagnose to see what I needed to get done . I saw Dr. Tan.  When Dr. Tan came and check my teeth and X-ray said I probably just need a cleaning and I had 2 cavities that need filling. They offered to do the cleaning that day and  I was ok with it. I have insurance so I knew that was cover and didn’t have to pay anything. The hygienist also told me I needed a panoramic x ray and that my insurance doesn’t cover so it was going cost me $92 and handed me this paper to sign it . I get very high anxiety at dentist office so I sign it without thinking any of it . She didn’t explain why I needed she just said it was to check if everything was normal . I’ve never had this done so I went with it. Now after my second visit I realized that panoramic x ray  is just a way to get money out of you and just to makes you pay for something you don’t really need . After I got my teeth cleaning dentist never came to check on hygienist work and they never went over the panoramic X-ray . I went go head and got my second appointment to get my “2 fillings” done . The girl at the desk told me it was going to be $116.

I went to my second appointment and of course I was anxious. The dental assistant tells me I need 3 fillings and it was going to cost me $155 . I asked her why 3 since I was told it was only 2 . She said her chart shows 3 fillings. Being anxious and wanting to get this done I just said ok and sign . Got my fillings done and paid . I went home and checked my teeth I can barely see the “3rd” filling . It makes me wonder if I even had 3rd cavity or was this just made up to get more money out of me ? . I don’t know wether there was a miscommunication or if they’re really just dishonest and taking advantage of people who are anxious ? !!!

I know part of it is my fault for not speaking  up and just sign a paper . But I hope this helps other people in future . I will not be coming back , I will be looking for new dentist .

name: Vallie Lee
text: Amazing.... Good dentist... Made my visit fast friendly and was very gentle. Thankful to have visted this dentist.

name: Wayne Mckerley
text: Very friendly and caring

name: kim Glenn
text: When I first went there Dr Kim saw me .He pulled 3 bottom teeth and was pretty gentle with me .I don't like going to dentist so of coarse this made me alittle ok with the fact I new I would need some dentures soon .Well if you want to be sure your satisfied and your dentures are right and will fit,you'll need to go elsewhere  .They don't give a damn if they were made rite,if there lined up rite ,if they fit,or if they were even made right  .They simply don't care,how you feel about them,the fact that they don't fit,it dosent matter.they have there money,so u got to deal with wat you got.My sister just got screwed by Aspen ,now I get screwed by Today's family Dental .Nobody cares about the other anymore.Its dog eat dog.no feelings,no compassion.just live with it and die

name: Teacher Debbie
text:
I have been to this dentist's office before and seen Dr. Kim. He always did a good job. However, I had a painful, decayed, infected back tooth and needed to be seen by whoever was available. When I called the office, I was able to get an appointment for the next day.

When I got to the dentist's office, I was called back immediately, which I thought was good. I was to see a Dr. Tan. Dr. Tan was nice, and told me that the tooth needed to come out. She numbed the area and left me in the chair in a position with my head down and my feet elevated. No one came in to check on me and I was in the chair for three hours. Finally, when Dr. Tan came in the second time after she had numbed me, she started working on my tooth. I told her that it was still hurting. She then said that she was not bragging on her numbing technique, but that the area had to be numb. She said that since it was decayed that she might have to dig around down there and if I was feeling pain, she could not do that. She did not offer me nitrous oxide or more lidocane. She sent me home without extracting the tooth. She prescribed antibiotics for a week and then said we would try again.

While I was in the chair, I was so cold that my feet were actually shaking. I was never offered a blanket or asked if I was OK. This office is always so loud as they have music playing and everyone is always talking to each other about their weekends or what they did the night before. I need a peaceful area when I am in a lot of pain.

I went home and looked up dentists in Birmingham and found a great one that removed my tooth the next day. I will not be going back to this dentist's office.

name: Ryan Dingler
text:
Been here many times. Always easy in and out. Dr. Tan was nice, funny, and did a great job each time. The dentists and assistants are very friendly and informative. I never consider going anywhere else.

I would definitely recommend them.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review.  We appreciate your business!

name: Lucas Elliott
text: Beware!!! Stay away from this dentist. They will get your child in the back and do extra procedures and not tell you until they are through. I told them I didn’t want my son receiving a filling that day. Everyone assured me that he wouldn’t be and once he was in the back they proceeded to do the filling without asking or telling me until they were finished. I will be filling a complaint with the state board of dentistry.

name: Sonja Renea
text:
My tooth extraction was terrifying since I was not completely numb yet. I have TMJ, which no one asked me about before it was done... in fact there was no consultation prior to extractions at all. I bought dentures from this office but I regret it. My TMJ is much worse now. They were not very informative or thorough. I felt like I was wasting their time with my concerns.

My dentures cause me pain because I have a small mouth, and these dentures have more teeth than my mouth was used to... I thought that was something they would have checked. But I was told that is the standard amount of teeth for a normal mouth (which I never had) that my bite looked fine and basically deal with it. I felt like once they had my money my comfort did not matter.

Even though I saved up for their "high end" dentures, they are very uncomfortable and I will be saving up to purchase another pair of dentures elsewhere as soon as I can afford it.

name: Chuck Noris
text: Went in to have one wisdom tooth removed. Staff were very curtious and made the visit comfortable and quick. Unfortunately, they charged my insurance $350.00+ for this one simple 15 minute procedure 😐. Over-charging insurance companies is the number one reason for high rates. Won't be going back.

resp.text: Hello Chris.  We are sorry that you are disappointed in our billing practices.  Just so you know, Dental Insurance works much differently than Medical Insurance.  What we "charged" your Dental Insurance makes no difference as the Insurance company sets the fees, not us.  We could have "charged" $1000 for the work you had done, and we would have been paid the same and written off a higher amount.  In fact, we typically have to write off ~33% of everything we do.  Most dental insurances companies haven't changed their fees in 5+ years, and we haven't raised our fees in the same time frame.  If you have any further questions in how Dental Insurance works, please feel free to give us a call.

name: Kristin W.
text:
I had a very, very bad experience here. Cindy did my cleaning, if you can call it that (bloodbath might be more accurate). The pick kept slipping and gouging my gums and it was extremely painful. According to her, my previous dental hygienists didn't do a thing to remove the plaque from my teeth because she announced that my mouth was in terrible shape, and didn't I know that I was supposed to brush my teeth regularly? When she started in on flossing and waggled her blood-stained fingers in front of my eyes, I got dizzy and started crying.

Dr. Peters came in next and said, "I hear you've been having some trouble! Did you know you're supposed to brush and floss your teeth? You have to be good about it, or else your teeth will end up looking like this..." at which point he gestured to a horrifying picture mounted on the wall featuring blackened and rotting teeth. He told me that my teeth shouldn't be so bad for someone my age and the cleaning shouldn't be so painful unless I haven't been taking care of them. People, I have been seeing dentists twice a year throughout my entire life, keeping up with my regular cleanings and x-rays, and no dentist has ever been this critical of me. I think Cindy was rough and careless, and defended herself against my crying by saying that I had terrible and highly sensitive teeth, and Dr. Peters took her at her word instead of asking her to leave the room and talking to me alone.

Between the condescension from both of them and the heavy-handed pick wielding, I will never ever recommend this practice, nor will I ever return there.

text: I’m super sad because I like Dr. Summerford. I have been a patient for many years and was told this last time that it was now $25 to reschedule an appointment within 24 hours. I have 3 small children and a last second issue with child care. Unfortunately, that is now how you should treat patients and it looks like a desperate money grab. Anyone with a busy life knows that cleanings are scheduled months in advance and life issues can change in a second. I will be finding a new dentist.

resp.text: Ashlyn, we are truly sorry that you feel the need to leave, and we understand your frustration.  We've had to implement this new policy due to the increase in patients who cancel with short notice or don't even bother showing up to their appointment.  On average 20% of our appointments every day do this which inhibits us from scheduling appointments for those patients who want or need them on certain days or times.  We also reserve time and resources for these patients which are lost when appointments are lost.  We hope this might explain why we've had to implement this policy.

text: I had been going to this dental office for cleaning for 3-4  years until recently.  Last week I had the dental cleaning at my new dental office, the hygienist was very puzzled that I had a lot of calcification buildups even I had cleaning every six months at Central Park Dental.  Apparently the hygienist at Central Park Dental did not do a thorough job.

resp.text: Minehwa, we're sorry you feel like you received sub-optimal care at our office.  We can assure you, however, that every patient receives a thorough cleaning.  We accept nothing less.  We cannot comment on your situation due to HIPAA regulations.  As a general point of information, some patients acquire calculus buildup more easily and quickly than others due to factors both within their control and outside of their control.  For that reason, not all patients receive cleanings every six months although most do.  A small amount of patients require cleanings yearly while others require them every 3-4 months.  Again, we are sorry that you feel that you didn't receive the care you deserve, and if you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to call our office.

Although COVID-19 has changed some things, the care starting at the reception area and continuing through checkout can’t be beat. They are so intuned to a child’s needs it instantly puts them at ease. Prior to COVID they would have several assistants working with your child. They talk to them massage their arms and legs while getting cleanings and fillings. Just beautiful 🥰

They make it a great experience for you and your child or grandchild. They leave happy and unafraid of coming back.

text: Katherine and Tracey were the first friendly faces that I met when I came in! Katherine made sure the check-in process was speedy and she was very informative, and she explained the day's process with me, which I greatly appreciated. Tracey was and is incredibly kind! She made me feel so comfortable from the start, especially when she reassured me about my facial piercings as I was afraid that I would have to remove them while they are still healing. She was also very knowledgeable and explained everything to me simply and clearly. I felt that I could relate to her and talk to her comfortably. Dr. Ferreira was so nice and had such a warm energy! She made me feel comfortable, and she also listened and aided me in my concerns about wanting braces, which no other dentist had done for me before. Summer, my hygienist, soothed my worries when she told me my treatment moving forward would be fairly easy. I was afraid that I hadn't been doing my part completely and that she would find something disastrous, but she said my teeth were great and gave me a few tips moving forward! Everyone in the office was extremely courteous, kind, and made the process painless. I was probably out of there within an hour or so and left more comfortable than when I came in. Thank you to everyone!

text:
First time with Aspen and we were a bit hesitant initially. I didn't like the idea of a chain dentist office, but having recently joined the military, I wanted to set my wife up with a place that would seem more consistent through multiple moves. I've seen the buildings around multiple places, so it seemed like a good idea to try it.
So far, we're very happy with the experience. My wife was happy with the people who worked with her, and the initial processing was pretty easy and very well explained. My favorite part was with Ms. Mayfield at the financial desk. She was very friendly, but also competent and efficient; put us immediately at ease.
I walked away feeling very confident that we understood her dental care plan and the expected costs associated with it. Financially, they were very transparent, and I definitely appreciated that after some previous experiences at other places.

name: TERRY Glisson
text: This place is a total scam and a ripoff do yourself a favor and don't go. I made an appointment for today to get a cleaning and I even made an extra trip before my appointment time for them to verify my insurance and I was told yes they take it. My insurance pays up to $1500.00 per year for dental. I get to my appointment and after waiting 35 minutes past my appointment time they take me back and do the x-ray then put in another room where a woman comes in and does a very brief look around my mouth and I am told I have no cavities but I do have a very bad build up on my teeth which is true. They also say I have mild periodontal disease which is probably true also but here is were it gets crazy. The tell I am going to see another woman to tell me what it will cost me. I said it shouldn't cost me anything my insurance pays up to $1500.00 to which they reply that the insurance will only cover a normal cleaning and since I need a deep cleaning I have to pay. Then they proceed to tell me that even with my insurance my cost for a deep cleaning will be anywhere from $2000.00 to $3500.00 I told them no way and that I thought they were crooks and walked out. After I left I did a Google search for what it should cost to have a deep cleaning done and it comes back the it should cost between $750.00 and $1200.00 meaning my insurance should have covered it. Now I have no idea how much they are gonna bill my insurance for what they did but I would bet it will take a huge chunk out of my $1500.00 of coverage so when I find a reputable dentist I now won't have the full amount available for that dentist. Do yourself a favor and don't ever go there the will rip you off.

resp.text: I am so sorry Terry, this was not the experience we want for our patients. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, my team would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Cindy, ADMI

name: Pelles Asher
text:
I had a consultation for a simple cleaning and chipped tooth. I left feeling like I was put through a machine! The appointment took twice the time I was quoted and I tried to wait for the person to make a follow up appointment but I ended up just wandering the halls until I found my way out. Im 40 years old and have been going to the dentist every 6 months of my entire life and I have never had such an "unfeeling" dental experience.

I have no dentures, partials, cavities and still felt like I was put through the ringer. I was not hurt, prodded, ridiculed or demeaned in anyway but I did not feel safe, comfortable or appreciated. I will not come back and I would never recommend Aspen. That being said I did get xrays and the dentist came in for a few moments to look in my mouth to verify I didnt have anything wrong. I am going back tomorrow to sign a HIPPA release to have the records and the xrays (I paid for!) released in 7-10 business day to the new dentist I chose over Aspen. Sigh.

I also was recommended a procedure that is not and was not necessary, i refused the chemical prescription strength mouthwash and denied the procedure but was told because I did not accept the (unnecessary debridement) gingivitis procedure that they would not clean (polish) my teeth. Appauled! I wish I could upload pictures of my teeth right now, they are perfect, gums and all. Im sorry but if I dont want to give $100 dollars out of pocket for an optional treatment I shouldn't have too.

Me, myself, and my cavity-less mouth won't ever be back and it would take hell or highwater to ever recommend them for anything other then ripping someones teeth out...which I heard one of their dentist talking about while I was there, I shuttered. Ever see the little shop of horrors dentist?!

Aspen, I get it youre a chain but going to the dentist sucks for everyone...find your roots, try not to be the Walmart of dentistry and Aspen if you do choose to become a WallyWorld, lower your prices for sh*t we dont need.

resp.text: I'm really sorry to hear that, Pelles. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, my team would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Cindy, ADMI

name: keith cavender
text: I had a great experience with this aspen dental office. I had been in agony for 4 days. They were very accommodating and got me the first emergency appt they had. When I arrived at the office they checked me in on the phone in the parking lot in adherence to social distancing during this pandemic. They got me in after an extended wait. But bear in mind this was an emergency appt. Once inside they took a full set of xrays. The dentist came in and discussed the options with me all of which included the extraction of the tooth that had cause so much pain over the last few days. I met with the office manager, paid for the extraction, and went back to wait on the dentist to perform the extraction . I was moved to a procedure suite and the extraction was preformed under local anesthesia. I was released about 20 mins later. I was at the office almost 4 hours but again this was an emergency appt. I returned home and continue antibiotics prescribed by the emergency room 48 hours earlier. The swelling in my jaw and face is slowly going down. The pain is being controlled well with tylenol and advil. Give the fact that they made the emergency appt on Saturday for the first thing available and that I had to drive 40 miles to the office, I was grateful to get the appt as even emergency appointments during the pandemic are hard to get. The experience overall was positive and the staff was very friendly and professional. Thank you a gain for your help with this very painful and unexpected event. I will use aspen dental locally as a dental provider and recommend then to anyone whether having a dental crisis or for routine dental care. The treatment plan and cost are explained up front. They offer third party financing should you need it which could have been a viable option had it been necessary. Thanks again Aspen Dental. Great customer service and great dental service. The cost to get the tooth removed that had caused me such agony for days was $134. Fortunately I had the money to pay for the services. I highly recommend their services.

resp.text: I'm so glad that the team was able to accommodate you, Keith. Thanks for sharing that it was a positive experience! - Dawn, ADMI

name: Eric Chamberlin
text:
I made an appointment with Aspen Dental back in January because they could get me in on short notice. Most of the other dentists I contacted had about a 3 to 4 week wait. The day I arrived they provided me with x-rays and a quick inspection which included reading a bunch of numbers that were above 5 when they measured my teeth. Shortly thereafter they informed me I needed a deep cleaning procedure and a bunch of other treatments. Of course this procedure was going to be over $1,000 out of my own pocket. It was not covered by my insurance. They also informed me of a cavity that would need a root canal and it would be a separate procedure at an endodontist they recommended that of course would be more. They then tried to get me to go into a small room and sign paperwork to pay for the procedure. I left and figured I would get a second opinion.

I decided to wait and made an appointment with Complete Family Dental also in Phenix City. They were able to do a cleaning for me and also fix my cavity tooth with a filling rather than a root canal and Crown. My insurance also covered almost all of the procedures and total cost out of pocket was only $150.

Also there was no deep cleaning procedure necessary and the numbers they read when measuring my teeth were all three or less.

It should be noted that I did not inform Complete Family Dental that I had visited Aspen. I wanted to see what they would say to make sure I wasn't being ripped off and if I indeed needed a deep cleaning procedure or a root canal.  Furthermore the dentist at Complete Family Dentistry fixed another filling free of charge because he noticed some decay building up behind that filling on the same tooth he was fixing already. I had my tooth fixed just this week. Definitely worth the wait.

I recommend getting a second opinion if Aspen tries to get you for their 'deep cleaning' procedures.

The staff is friendly enough, but you can tell that they've all been brainwashed with corporate training sessions to push the vulnerable into unnecessary treatments. Victoria is particularly cutthroat and snarky.

I'm glad that they didn't get any money from me. The initial exam was enough to see that this is the used car sales of dentistry. Save your time, money and sanity. Steer clear of this dental practice.
