text: Please don’t be fooled, the pricing is outrageous and the staff is extremely rude and condescending. I have never had such an unpleasant experience with any medical professional. I will be sure to let each and every person I come in contact with, of the terrible experience I have had. I’m discussed.

resp.text: Thank you for providing this information.  I would really like to speak with you.  Will you please call me at (844) 296-0187 ext. 201152 — Julie, ADMI

name: Virginia Johnson
text: Dr. Ross and the staff in the back were very friendly and nice,  but the office girl up front was not friendly at all. A little smile and thank you when I gave her my papers, that I filled out at home, is not going to hurt anyone.

name: Renee Thomas
text: This was my first visit. I was expecting to go in, get a procedure done and leave. Instead, I got a free initial exam, and everyone explained things to me and listened to my concerns, my fears, and my input on what they were telling me. The doctor and hygentist, office manager, and dental assistants were all very professional. Because of my dental issues, I will have my first procedure done in two days, and I have confidence that they will do a great job and help me ease my fears of the dentist.

name: Charles Key
text: Went in yesterday for my first exam.  Everybody was very friendly and knowledgeable. I have allot of work to be done and the prices seem to be good.

name: H P
text: Told me I had a ‘dangerous gum disease’ and that the dentist would be in shortly to tell me ‘what procedure’ would be necessary.  They were talking about gingivitis LOL.  Flossed and rinsed vigorously for 2 weeks and done for about $7.  This place just tries to scare you in to paying more and squeezing visits and procedures out of you. Find a you a local dentist- you’ll be glad you did.

resp.text: I'm sorry you felt that way, Hannah. We value your feedback, and I will pass your message along to our Patient Satisfaction team. - Emily, ADMI

name: Lisa Mitchell
text: As always, service was amazing!  Everyone I have had contact with is professional and courteous.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing, we appreciate the kind words and value your feedback. —Julie, ADMI

name: Shakethia Norton
text: I went in for a procedure that I thought was supposed to be a total procedure: Bridge work, deep cleaning, etc. It was explained to me before going that the cost of the procedure was 1000 plus dollars but both insurances would pay the cost of up to 900 and some change. Nothing was explained in detail to me. I got the deep cleaning that i know damn well doesn't cost 1000.00 and it was only one cleaning!  I received a bill in the mail for 454.00.  Now my teeth feel worse after having my teeth pulled and the cleaning...I will be finding another dentist immediately and i should have listened to the reviews.

resp.text: I'm so glad to hear that the team put you at ease and helped you have a positive experience. Enjoy your future visits, Shakethia! - Emily, ADMI

name: leslie russell
text: Very professional! Very sweet! Made a grown nervous woman feel at ease! Thanks for a good experience ❤️

name: Chyna Corum
text: Went in today for my six month cleaning. Since I’d been in last December, they have new doctors and I wasn’t aware, which is fine. However, I’ve had fillings done and the new doctors have no record of the last filling that I had and are wanting to fill and make me repay for a tooth even after it’s already been filled. I feel as if they’re trying to make me think I’m crazy when I know for a fact that I went in to have that specific tooth filled. When I asked them what was it I paid for then, they told me they didn’t know because they weren’t there at that time. So in their minds, there was a doctor messing around in my mouth, telling me he was filling a tooth when he really didn’t? They are also saying I have another cavity that I wasn’t aware I had (they didn’t find it this time, apparently it’s been there sometime but I’m assuming the previous doctors didn’t tell me or it’s not true??). Aspen was fine when I first went to them a little over a year ago but I feel that they have become very unprofessional. I don’t understand how they can just tell patients that they didn’t have a specific work done just because there’s no record of it because they changed doctors. I will not be paying twice for work that I know for a fact that I had done. I will be finding a new dentist that doesn’t have multiple doctors in and out. Dr. A at Aspen informed that I would see doctors come and go from there and I’d much rather be at a facility that has the same doctor(s) so that I don’t have this unprofessionalism.

name: chiquta mosley
text: The staff was very friendly and when I say Dr.Ross was Great!!!! she was Great!!! .Didn't feel any pain at all.

resp.text: We’re happy to know you had a great experience, Chiquta.  Thank you for sharing! – Courtney, ADMI

name: Joyce Wilson
text: Very professional while also personable. Explained in terms a layperson found understandable. State of the art facility; yet comfortable and concerned with my confusion. Lovely staff /Denise! and of course Dr. Green.  Would  recommend to my own family.

name: Misty Davis
text:
It was a great experience. I've suffered for a few years with 2 top plates that never fit & were very uncomfortable, & crooked. (I tried going with a nationally advertised, cheaper same day service). Cheaper is not always better!! I set up an appointment, got in the next day. Everyone was very professional, caring, & understanding. They done everything to make me comfortable & to meet my needs. Needless to say after being there nearly 4 hours, I walked out with a great big smile, new denture, no adhesive, I can honestly say my experience was a blessing! Also the staff was super excited for me. They made sure everything was perfect, to my standards. (They even stayed a few minutes late to accomodate me).
Still Smiling!!!!😁😁😁😁😁

name: SHANAAH CHEREE
text: The staff is so friendly and inviting! They make you feel welcome regardless of what your teeth look like. I would recommend it over most dentists in my area.

name: Beverly Gonzalez
text: My experiences at Aspen Dental have been nothing short of great! In the past, I had suffered so many traumas from going to the dentist that I would have anxiety attacks just thinking about going. And, the cost that came with those visits, to me was not worth it. Well, Aspen Dental of Decatur changed all that for me! From the moment I stepped into their friendly staffed office on the Beltline; I was treated like a star. The receptionist was professional and polite. Ashley, the ex-ray tech, did everything to make me feel comfortable without making me feel "shamed" for the poor condition of my teeth. Dr. Tara Cochran (who will, probably, be my dentist for the rest of my life..I hope), she gave me all the necessary information so that I could make a good choice in my dental plan. And, Tawana, their VERY helpful, professional office manager helped me find a third-party finance party that gave me a VERY reasonable payment plan. NOW, I have a beautiful smile in the works thanks to Dr. Cochran, Chloe, Claire, Ashley, Savana, and Sean! I know that this is a long review, but I just want everyone who reads this, and you need ANY type of dental care; go to Aspen Dental of Decatur. You will not regret it.

resp.text: That's wonderful to hear, Beverly! Thank you for sharing! -- Kelsey, ADMI

name: JRJ
text:
Unfortunately, Decatur, Al. office does not perform implant dentures. I was redirected to the Cullman, Al. office which is  a further drive. Plus the visit was .a waste of a lot of time. Driving to and fro, and waiting to be seen  by the DR. I am disabled and do not drive but short distances  so this also involved another person's time.  Your staff was nice and  friendly.  Although
when i first made the appointment I was told this office did do implant dentures, I informed them I currently have  5 implants now. But wasn't redirected to call the Cullman office.
Thanks

text: I was told don't worry we will take care of everything with the insurance company so they do all the work pulled 3 teeth that I wish I had never done and got new dentures top and bottom, well they never got right ,so one of the lady dentist told me they would upgrade them at no cost and they would fit better and not hurt as much I already paid 1500.00 out of pocket well my insurance didn't pay all I still owed then 385. Well now that I got the comfy lites that don't fit no better they sending me a bill for 2000.00 for the balance and the upgrade to the better ones. The staff is very nice and professional but their new manager is a different story. It's on my chart and I've tried to call and talk to the office manager and explain this they told me it wouldn't cost me nothing. And ever who answers these reviews isn't nice either! Ok now that I paid the 385.00 apparently they are charging me another 565.00 for the upgrade and have turned it over to collections! I don't understand why they say one thing and turn around and do another. I will not recommend them to anybody again. Something ain't right when all the employees go to somewhere else.

text: I had a tooth ache and they were very nice. My name is pam brewer.they pulled the next day and doing fine.

text: Good doctors, great Office managers, but the other staff could be more friendly.

name: regina gamble
text: They are more concerned with running my bill up and gouging me & my insurance company than fixing my tooth which is the reason for my visit. First took about 30 x-rays and I have only 27 teeth. Second visit for required gingivitis treatment which was supposed to take 45 minutes too and hour but only took 15 minutes my past teeth cleaning did more and we're free instead of uncovered cost $150. Set up third appointment because insurance paid for follow check up gingivitis treatment tooth still not fixed. Also prices on website with coupons doesn't apply since I have insurance double the price and they count tooth different surfaces vs per tooth for filings which is different from all other dentists I've gone too. Plus state bill over $2000 but doesn't provide and itemized copy for you too review very shady....

name: Sue Marron
text: Modern office friendly staff very knowledgeable on treatment.

resp.text: That's wonderful to hear, Sue! Thank you for sharing! -- Kelsey, ADMI

name: Steve Smith
text: Overall a good experience. Wait time was a bit much but everyone was very friendly and explained the processes thoroughly.

name: angela perry
text: This place is a joke I made an appointment to have my teeth cleaned I arrive wait over an hour then a lady comes and gets me for X-ray she tore my mouth to pieces not to mention very rude after that they tell me this is a assessment and they will next measure my teeth to come up with a treatment plan are you serious none of this was disclosed when I made an appointment for a CLEANING and after all this refuse to give me my x-rays stay far away from these people

name: Tiffany Kimbrough
text: I was also so scared to go to the dentist but aspen dental made me feel a at home and everyone was so nice and friendly

resp.text: I'm happy to hear that, Tiffany! It’s great that you felt comfortable with the team, and I hope that you find it easier to continue making your oral health a priority. - Emily, ADMI

name: Arielle Cain
text: The office manager is horrible. I had a root canal completed at another location. Fast forward and I begin to have issues with the tooth that had the root canal. I call the Decatur office (I now live closer to this location, unfortunately) and specifically ask if they will be able to address an issue that another location serviced. The office manager encourages me to come to their office for the issue. A month goes by and it is the day of my appointment. I call and ask if I may come in early since I finished up with work early. The receptionist puts me on hold to speak with the office manager.(DUM, DUM, DUM...*music fit for a villain begins to play**not really, but it should have*) He begins to say that they can't work on the issue and I would need to visit the Aspen Dental location that completed the root canal. ( If you're reading this Greg, in the future you might want to do your research about your company's policies before wasting another person's time) The office manager goes on to tell me that he called and left a voicemail yesterday to tell me all of this information. And I told him that I didn't have a missed call or voicemail from him. And that I thought it was ironic that the other five calls that we exchanged a month ago were never missing from my phone. Only now that I explain that I am irritated that when I called a month ago he gave me a different answer are his call and voicemail from yesterday "magically" absent from my phone. He proceeds to say, "well I know for a fact that I called and left a voicemail." To which I respond, " I know for a fact that I don't have a missed call or voicemail. He then laughs sarcastically. So I told him, " since he thought it was appropriate to speak to me that way then I decided to respond in the same manor." And the conversation ends with him telling me that they will not ever see me in their office. If I could give zero stars, I would. If he would have just apologized and not smarted off, I would have been understanding. Extremely horrible experience. I hope the office manager deals with a similar incident differently in the future. Too bad this compliant won't see the light of day in a performance review.

name: Carolyn Haynes
text: I went to Cumberland back in 2015 to get fillings and a root canal done. Long story short, I have paid three times to get the same filling re-done and now my crown has came out which will result in me paying more money at another dentist office. I agree with others, they seem very rushed at everything they do, but I can’t afford for them to keep messing up costing me money. Never again will I go back, good luck to those who do and kudos to those who have had a better experience.

name: Flenardo Taylor
text: If they would take pride in their customers like their Christmas decoration. People will love them.  I read the reviews and I have to agree. The front staff wasn't so friendly. Only came for an exam. The dentist was cool.

name: Stephen McGatha
text: Been going for over a year now. They seem to genuinely offer good dental services. Fairly good at keeping dental appointments.

name: April Jordan
text: The worst place I've ever been.. Went to get 3 fillings put in and I was in so much pain for several days. The dentist never said a word to me when I went to get the fillings not even hello... I do not recommend this place to anyone. When I went back due to so much pain I found out he put the filling in too deep and hit a nerve now I have to get the tooth pulled or a root canal... SMH.. The worst place

name: Melissa Simmons
text: I went in last Saturday to get 4 wisdom tooth removed when I got back in the room for them to proceed to do the procedure I feel it was a rush job and they was just ready to go home dr. Kelly had no bedside manners in my opinion she was just ready to clock out to me I feel as if she was trying to talk me out of it after I paid cash money with no insurance to get it done after about four to five days at home I noticed the back of my teeth had a funny taste with something coming out of them I put a napkin in my mouth to find that it was yellow stuff coming out of it I immediately called the office on a Saturday during business hours no one ever picked up the phone after I got off work I proceeded to call back that night in the answering service picked up and I told her that someone needed to get in contact with me because it was an emergency and what the situation was this was Sunday it is now 4:10 p.m. Monday and no one has still contacted me I went to the emergency room on Sunday night and they told me the antibiotic that I got with the procedure that I had I should not have that antibiotic they put me on more antibiotics of which I had to pay for my ER visit but long story short I wouldn't recommend taking a dog to this place with no one contact you about an emergency that is a red flag!!!!!

text: New Hope Family Dentistry has been our family dentist for over 3 years, we are blessed to have such an outstanding office in our little town. Also, everyone we’ve met on the staff is fantastic! Don’t know how they remember our names when we are only in their Twice per year! If your looking for a dentist, check out New Hopes Family Dentistry!

text: I have been to many different dentists and this one is by far my favorite! I live an hour away but will make the drive any day to come here! Everyone is so friendly and caring when you come in! They have worked with me throughout my pregnancy to make sure that what needs fixed gets fixed and that we don't cause harm to the baby in any way. I couldn't ask for a better or friendlier dentist to go to! I recommend this dentist to anyone!

name: L Stroud
text: I recently had dental implants done by Dr. McMillan and could not be more pleased. The procedure itself was  basically painless and there was only minor discomfort afterwards. I have previously used oral surgeons for this type of dental work, but from now on, I will definitely be calling on Dr. McMillan. He is the nicest person and it's very easy to discuss your concerns with him. He and his entire staff are the friendliest folks you would ever hope to meet and they will go out of their way to help you and make you feel comfortable from the moment you walk in the door. OUTSTANDING in every way!

Dr. McMillan, dental  assistants, and hygienist have provided my husband and I with excellent quality work and service. The hygienist provides the deep tissue work my husband requires saving him a trip to Huntsville. This is the first dentist to provided me with an upper dentures that fit perfectly the first time with no adjustments. The partial was took some work. The office staff is extremely competent and helpful with appointments, insurance issues and has even provided me a report needed for a taxes.
Personal comfort, excellent care and professionalism is what I expect and receive.
Would I recommend Dr. McMillan?  YES, I have and do.

name: Nikki Sumner
text: This is the best dentist that I have ever been to. I went in last week with a toothache that was not really hurting anymore. Dr. McMillan told me I needed a root canal.so I schedule it. Well as the week went on my tooth didn't hurt. I almost canceled my appointment but decided to go in anyways. When he came in the room I asked him are you sure I need this done. I dont want to go through any unnecessary pain. He allowed me to watch him perform the test on each tooth on the upper right side. After that I agreed it need to be done. He could tell I was nervous so he offered yo do a live camera so I could see what he was doing. All I can say is "IT WAS AMAZING." Thank you to all the wonderful staff at New Hope Family Dentistry.

text: My husband was a client of this clinic for several years. And he came from Pensacola. Last week, the VA was allowed to give him another apoitment.  My husband called and left a voice message.  A few hours later , he got a call back, as it turned out, from the clinic. My husband receives thousands of calls from various Scam and advertising companies. And this call he credited to the Scam and did not respond properly. When he realized that there was a misunderstanding, he called back again, deeply apologized. That's it!!! Since then, silence!!!! I , his wife , called, WA called. Expensive clinic and a wonderful doctor! You need to change the receptionist.  A clinic that works to provide services should probably at least answer incoming calls.

name: Karen Allyn
text: I had the most extensive dental exam that I have ever had.  Everyone that took care of my check up including the girls who did my X-rays and tooth scan, the hygienist, and the Dentist were so professional, knowledgeable and courteous.  They all made me feel very comfortable and they were very gentle.  I enjoyed being there- not the usual feeling going to a Dentist’s office.  I feel everyone was very thorough and helpful to answer any questions I had.  This is the first time since the pandemic started, that I had been to a Dentist, besides me being fairly new to the area, so I was not looking forward to going, but I was so pleasantly surprised.  I actually got a first appointment quickly, also, within a week of me calling for an appointment.  I had a female Dentist, I am sorry but I forgot her name, but she was great in every way.  I am a RN, so I recognize professional, knowledgeable and courteous, great patient care.  I just can’t say how impressed and pleased I am that I chose Aspen Dental to go to.  I am looking forward to my cleaning appointment in two weeks.  Thanks again.

resp.text: I'm glad you enjoyed your visit, Karen. Patient Satisfaction is very important to Aspen Dental practices, and it's great to hear that the team helped you have a 5-star experience. - Cindy, ADMI

name: The Gaming Husky
text: Everyone at Aspen was wonderful.  They are so nice and helpful.  No judgement if you haven’t been to the dentist in a while, they pick up where you left off.  They have payment arrangements that work with any budget and are more thank happy to help set things up and make a new smile happen.  Thank you to the staff to at Aspen Dental in Daphne, Alabama.

name: Diane Abercrombie
text:
This was my initial appointment at Aspen Dental. From the receptionist to the Dentist, I was treated with enthusiasm, respect , professional and courtesy.
I was extremely impressed with the technology used to evaluate the dental health of a patient in conjunction with the physical examination.
The dentist, dental hygienist, x-ray technician, insurance manager were absolutely superb!
The hygienist explained the findings on my dental scan, which I have not experienced anywhere else. It was very informative and helpful in making priority dental work decisions.
The dentist, Dr. Dickinson was the last to evaluate me. He thoroughly reviewed all diagnostics, medical history, medications, etc.
What really stood out to me was his quick whit and demeanor. He made you feel like a family member. His evaluation was positive, to include the discussion of problem areas. You didn’t feel marginalized and berated because your teeth aren’t celebrity status.
Aspen Dental is an entirely different type of dental practice. They offer flexibility in payment plans, especially for those without dental insurance.
The prices are excellent, and far less than other quotes I’ve received.
Aspen Dental is a one- stop shop. When you receive stellar front desk, hygienist, radiology technician, patient-centered education relevant to your specific healthcare needs, and a dentist who’s actually enthusiastic to provide your dental care; that’s a drop the mike, need I say more, touchdown 🙏🏾.

resp.text: I'm glad you appreciated your visit, Diane. Patient satisfaction is very important to Aspen Dental practices, and it's great to hear that the team helped you have a great experience. - Cindy, ADMI

name: Grant Ritter
text: It was a very pleasant experience.  The Dr. and staff were very nice and the exam was very thorough.  I would recommend this place 👌.

resp.text: It's so nice to hear that, Grant. I'm glad you had a 5-star experience, and we truly appreciate you taking a moment to recommend the Aspen Dental team! - Krista, ADMI

name: margaret c
text: My initial visit was awesome, I had a very extensive dental exam and was relieved to see that I could get my fillings done relatively cheaply without insurance. However I have an anxiety disorder and it felt like like they were rushing with me, I was not made to feel at ease. The second appointment I had was to receive two fillings, when it came time to restore the natural anatomy of my teeth, it felt very rushed. She ended up grinding my two teeth down on the sides as well as the fillings. My natural tooth anatomy is gone, I still can't believe that happened. What's worse is the fact that I'm experiencing alot of pain in these two fillings, they are super sensitive to heat, cold and, pressure. I cannot eat very well, I am already struggling since I need so much work done. I will be going to a different dentist to get the work fixed. In the end this will end up costing me more time, money, and comfort.

resp.text: I'm so sorry that your experience didn't live up to expectations, Margaret. We certainly value your feedback, and I wanted to let you know that I passed your comment along to our Patient Satisfaction team. I would encourage you call them too, so they can learn more and try to address concerns. You can reach them directly at 1-866-767-0890. - Cindy, ADMI

text:
Went to Aspen Dental Daphne Alabama, a  month and a half ago in February  2021 set up an appointment for a month later on April 29th, 2021 after a full examination. Which was rushed and telling me if you don’t do the cleaning we want do your caps.  So I had another dental office do the cleaning because Aspens Office financial manager  said they can't do the caps on the same  day they do the cleaning, evening though thats the way they scheduling it.

Anyrate  So called on. April 28th to ask if my appointment is still scheduled for April 29th,  no one answered, I left message. I received a call back within an hour “Amazing!!  Well the association told me they had no scheduled appointment for me at all and are completely book up.  Not willing to help me at all.. I’m blown away !! I’ve  been waiting we’ll over a month, and half  amdyou have nothing scheduled?!  What kind of business is this?!!!  Aspen Dental is a complete and utter JOKE!! The most non customer service  oriented dental business I’ve ever had to deal with. Unbelievably the worst dental business ever.If I could give them a 0 or no star . I would, their not deserving of one star.

I would pay 3x times amount to someone other dental office  than have these clowns touch my mouth.  Can only imagine the work they would  do in your mouth if this is how the Business is ran. I will pass this forward to friends family social media etc.

Thanks wasting my time. You guys are horrible!!

Lee L

It is too shallow.” Anyway, she got it back in, but it came out again 6 weeks later, it fell out again while I was eating a piece of boiled potato. I found another dentist and he took great care in redoing it again, and it seems solid now. I will not tell anyone not to visit Aspen Dental, but I will not return.

That's how they do it there. Pay first and then the work is done. So sad and mad that they think they can add to my bill after it was paid in full.  Shame on you Aspen Dental.

name: Lorri McDaniel
text: After breaking a tooth on Friday and calling multiple places, I was told that Aspen would be able to help me on Monday morning. The location nearest me was unavailable for 2 weeks, I would have to drive to the next location which is an hour away. After induring a weekend of pain, I got up and made the hour trip. After multiple xrays and being told the tooth would need to be capped. I was then taken to someone to discuss payment options. I was then informed that it would take 2 weeks for the cap to come in. I asked about a temporary cap and was told that they don't do that. There was no way I could indure another 2 weeks of pain. I would not recommend using for emergency treatment. Thankfully I was able to find a much closer dentist who was able to remove my old filling and put on a temporary cap. Also, my permanent cap will only take 4 days. Only a $90 difference in price but, I'll receive quicker service and not have to wait 2 weeks in pain.

resp.text: I am so sorry Lorri, this was not the experience we want for our patients. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, my team would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Cindy, ADMI

text: Dr. Stephanie and her whole team were great! I was very apprehensive about having dental work done at all, much less to the invasive degree I knew I would need. I would highly recommend this Aspen Dental office and Dr. Stephanie in particular and will continue to use them again for all my future dental needs! Pricing was also very competitive in my opinion, and every effort was made to make sure the total came in under the number I needed in order to get the most important and pain relieving procedures done in the single visit I requested. I was supposed to hear from the office manager about getting an appointment with the dentist I want but it's been a week and no word. Poor form again. name: Delta Blue
text:
All-all, it was one of the best Appointments at a dentist I have ever had, since I developed an extreme anxiety to dentists, dental offices, and anything else associated with the mouth and teeth.  The anxiety was a result of an unfortunate event as a child while at the dentist.
I am having major work done, to the tune of nearly $9000.  No, there are no implants included in that work.
The only downside was, after having my appointment schedule, the morning of, they sent me a message about coming in a half hour early, to have an unplanned cleaning.  I had recently had a cleaning.  This news about the cleaning the morning of, totally freaked me out, and turned me into a slobbering idiot.  I had to call several times, crying, to get them to understand what happens, when anything changes on my calendar within a few hours, if it is something I already fear.
However, when I got there, after I had explained on the phone, I couldn't do the cleaning and the procedure back to back, I calmed down, took with me everything to distract me and get me more comfortable, it was FINE.
Before I knew it, we were done!
Yahoo!
I have another appointment in 5 days, for dreaded cavities, and am praying the appointment will go just as smooth!
Thank you guys at Aspen, for helping me restore my teeth and smile.  God Bless.

name: B Lewis
text: One of the worst dental experiences in my life.  I went to them initially to have an annual checkup and to have a chip/break in my front tooth repaire.  The repair they made looked fine but only  lasted less a few weeks.  Then the dentist recommended that I get a crown.  My tooth was prepared and they took molds of my teeth for the crown and supposedly  did a color match (WRONG).  When the tooth came back it was the wrong color.  But the temporary tooth that was put on in it's place fell out the first day.  No adhesive was applied.  The  doctor left before the temporary was placed in my mouth and the technician who put it in obviously used no glue.  I did not go back for them to glue the temporary (my fault/busy schedule).  I just persevered until the crown came in,  When the first crown came in it was too long and the wrong color.  So it had to be sent back for a color change and to be  shorten.  I received another temporary tooth.   Well the doctor put on another temporary this time and  he really glued it on.  He glued it on with an adhesive that obviously was WRONG for a temporary because they could not easily remove it.  The next dentist I saw had to drill the temporary tooth off.  Then the second crown again was the wrong color (WRONG AGAIN!).  Another temporary was made and put on.   So now I am waiting for the crown (Third time) and hoping it is the right color.  In the meantime the temporary I had fell off while I was eating a salad a few days ago and is broken and can no longer be used to hide the ugly tooth stub.  I have this HIDEOUS gap and STUB of a tooth in the front of my mouth.   I have had so much anxiety regarding this dental situation and no resolution in sight for a few more days. This is not a matter of insurance, nor a matter of money...I have both and have paid in full my co-pay for this procedure.  It is a matter of good dental service of which I have yet to receive.  After the first two disastrous  appointments and having not received a crown that matches and is acceptable I  am very disappointed and disgusted with ASPEN Dental.

text: I was nervous going in cause of some of these reviews but I really enjoyed it the staff was extremely kind the cleaning was good I go back for a root canal soon but everyone was very kind I really enjoyed it

resp.text: Hi Gracie, Each person experiences life in their own way. Often times, a patient can come in with their own preconceived thoughts, as to how the outcome should be. However, when a dentist does the exam, and finds something different, they immediately feel upset. No one likes to get news of possible dental work that will need to be done. It's scary, and costly, we get that. Everyone has their own way of dealing with good and bad situations. We would hope that all our potential patients would rather make up their own decisions, based on their own experiences. You were pleasantly surprised, and we are thrilled you took the step to see for yourself!! Be well - Cindy, ADMI

name: Drew Humphrey-Morgan
text:
The receptionist keeps her front desk on point, sharp as a tac! The young lady over financial is a pleasure to work with. Kindly direct, honest, and offers very helpful advice!

My nurse delivered excellent care. Very considerate and thoughtful, she was in for the win during my predictable “episode” (Fainted. I don’t much like needles). But under her tender ministrations, I was soon ready for the main event.

Don’t let the young appearance of the doctor fool you, he is very competent and professional. I’m always apprehensive at the dentist, but his bedside manner and cool disposition proved to be very settling. I felt no pain! Zero, zilch, nada! Even now, I’m feeling great the day after having two teeth pulled!

I still have a long road ahead of me, but I’m glad I decided to go with these people. They are wonderful!

name: Angela Lawler
text: I am a little late in posting this review. But, felt it was important because people so easily post negative vs positive. Dr. Walker and his staff went above and beyond to meet my dental needs. I previously worked as a dental assistant while I was paying my way through college. So, I know a bit more than the average patient. I have to say that Dr Walker is far above average in his skill and chair-side manner. I had to have an extraction of #18. I never felt the injections.  And the actual extraction was done with speed and ease.  I hardly had any bleeding. I have assisted on many ,so I was prepared for the stress and pressure that one typically feels. Experience none of that with Dr. Walker.  A couple weeks later, I lost a significant portion of an old amalgam filling on#32. Yet, another difficult tooth position. Dr Walker was aware that I did not want to extract the tooth.  But, could not afford a crown at that particular time. Therefore, Dr. Walker spent extra time diligently repairing the tooth so that I wouldn't lose it. As previously  stated, it's  been about a year and 3 month and the tooth is still holding steady. Dr Walker is a brilliant Dentist with a kind heart. A combination not often found. Not to mention he makes you feel comfortable. As if you've been friends for years. In sum, He's as good as it gets. Aspen Dental and the Florence/Athens AL area are fortunate to have Dr Walker.  If he moves, I will travel to receive his care.  He took the time to earn my trust and respect.

resp.text: It's so nice to hear that, Angela. I'm glad the team helped you have a 5-star experience, and I hope you enjoy your future visits just as much. - Michelle, ADMI

As an experienced radiology tech, I must say these were the most comprehensive xrays that I have ever had done in my teeth. The hygienist came in and explained, tooth by tooth, where I had a gum problem, and if it appeared old  or new. The dentist listened and discussed my thoughts with me, not just telling me "we need to do this and this". Very nice visit. Very pleased.

text: We were not pleased at all with our experience at Aspen Dental. Xrays seemed excessive and were painful from the apparatus we had to hold in mouth repeatedly. Cleaning procedure was fine. text: People were very nice. But this place is very expensive.  But i would have been willing to pay it to get my mouth fixed. They claimed to have several financing options to chose from. However if you dont have really good credit you can't get the help promised. I would have been more than willing to pay the payments for help. Becsuse Chemo and radiation ruined my teeth and they are to the point of  me being hospitalized 3 times this year already dye to severe infection in my blood from them. And the so called caring and compassionate people do not care if you can't get the money up front. They could care less about you as a person. I am 54 and my got ruined in a divorce. What credit I had left git ruined when I had to quit work to take care of my husband who had stage 4 lung cancer and passed away 7 months later. I have devoted most of my life taking care of others. I raised my brother and sister, cared for my mother who had ovarian cancer, and my husband with lung cancer. I survived cancer after a long hard fight . And when I need help no one will help. Aspen dental gave me the name if a insurance company to buy dental insurance.  Then I still have to come up with thousands. They only want the money. They will not work with you and will not help you. And I desperately needed the help. No money  no help! And I would gave gladly paid the outrageous amount in payments and been very grateful to them.

resp.text: I'm sorry that you didn't have a positive experience. Thank you for sharing your feedback with us so that we can continue to improve patient experiences. - Dawn, ADMI

She told me a need a deep clean, and prescription mouth wash etc.
I had a filling going bad and i wanted that fixed.
They first send me to pay, fair enough,  oh and that cleaning and 1 filling would be 550 bucks, and " you are too far gone for a normal cleaning, and we will not fix that filling unless you pay for the deep cleaning".
At that time i requested my xrays and left, i recognize a hustle when i see one, STAY AWAY

resp.text: I'm really sorry to hear that.  If you would like to share more detail about your visit, I would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you about your experience. You can reach me directly at  844-296-0187 EXT 201152. - Julie, ADMI

name: Mary Bullard
text: Aspen Dental in Florence,AL has been a Godsend! I experienced horrendous wisdom teeth pain and had put off having them removed because I  have no dental insurance and an extreme anxiety toward needles going into my mouth. The pain got so bad that I ended up in the ER, which resulted in my having no choice but to get them out. I called Aspen Dental and they were so kind and helpful! They allowed me to set up an easy finance plan. They got me an appointment quickly. I had the x rays to be examined and the technician was so helpful by talking to me to make the long process of taking so many pictures go by super fast. I had an initial cleaning with a Mrs. Norma, whose vibrant smile and personality made me feel welcome and calmed my nerves tremendously.  During the cleaning they discovered I had gingivitis and they gave me a full treatment. They helped me get an Oral B toothbrush with Bluetooth capabilities and different modes for brushing and cleaning my teeth on my own. Mrs. Norma took time to give me tips on how to floss better so that I can prevent getting gingivitis again. When it came time to have my surgery, Dr. Perry helped my nerves by telling me what he was doing, when he was doing and why. Dr. Perry took time and didn't rush the process. The dental assistant that day was Mrs. Kourtney. I'll never forget how she kept me calm by reassuring me that I would be fine. She said being nervous was ok and normal. She kept telling me I was doing great. I don't think she knows how much I needed that. She kept my mouth suctioned, which I really liked because I have a tendency to have a gag reflex and that prevented it. Dr. Perry earned my trust and respect especially when he made the decision to divide my surgery in half. He did the left side, then had me wait two weeks for the other because he was concerned about my being able to eat comfortably. When he did the right side, he was assisted by a trainee who was kind also and attentive to my needs. If she continues to do as she did, she will be great! Overall, they really are a great place to go for dental needs. Even though I didn't need to use him, it also felt good knowing they have an oral surgeon with their office too. They will now be my go to for dental work! Thank you Aspen Dental!

resp.text: I'm happy to hear that you felt comfortable with the team, Mary! I hope that you find it easier to continue making your oral health a priority. - Emily, ADMI

name: Dedrick Casey
text: Great service fast and friendly.  They worked me in a slot to get my dental work done. I was in and out in no time.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing, Dedrick! I am happy to hear about your outstanding visit. We really appreciate the recommendation! — Dawn, ADMI

name: Deborah Bartlett
text: My mom has had the same cap put on 6!! Times in less than three months. She eats nothing but liquid room temperature for two days, then soft foods for two days. It still comes off while eating mashed potatoes, bread, and other soft foods. They are very nice in the office but don’t get caps put on there. It is either not molded right, or they are not doing it right.

name: Michael Lowery
text: Called to reschedule my appointment for Saturday and then they have nothing available for a while. Will not use them ever and suggest that you don't either.

resp.text: I'm sorry that your experience didn't live up to expectations. We value your feedback, and I will pass your message along to the team so they can address concerns. - Michelle, ADMI

name: Whit Shoemaker
text: Usually we see another dentist, but Aspen is the only place around here open past 5. To start, the staff are not friendly. We came to have my husband's tooth pulled, but Dr. Walker had him come back another day (next available appointment was a week later, so he had to suffer for.a week) because he didn't want to stay a little late. As if it were our fault they fell behind and we didnt get called back until well after his scheduled appointment. Our appointment was at 5:45, and we didn't get called back until almost 7. l So we had to make two trips, and they were supposedly short staffed both times. If you are looking for a friendly, time conscious dentist, try Dr. Chastain in Killen.

resp.text: Hi, thank you for your feedback.  I will certainly pass this information along to the staff, so they can address your concerns. — Dawn, ADMI

resp.text: Shantae - I'm glad you enjoyed your visit with the team. Thanks so much for taking the time to share! - Stephanie, ADMI

name: Bobby Frye
text: I was very nervous going in for my appointment but as soon as I walked in the building that all melted away. The staff was amazing. They were very welcoming and inviting. X-ray tech was very kind and made me feel very comfortable even though I was in pain. No long waits or beating around the bush. Dr was straight forward as well as the hygienist. Treatment plan was explained to me in terms everyone can understand and there was no extra added to create more revenue. Aspen dental has won my business and I urge everyone that is having trouble or doesn't at least walk in and meet the staff. It's free for your first consultation and x-rays. You have nothing to lose but a wonderful smile to gain. Aspen dental is where it is at.

name: Emily
text: I was hopeful that Aspen Dental would workout for me judging by the fact that I travel for work often and it would be convenient with the various locations. I am sad to say that my experience with Aspen has been extremely unsatisfactory. Not only has it been very pricey, I have been given multiple excuses as to why they cannot give me the filling I need. I have been to Aspen a total of five times and have been schedule for yet ANOTHER cleaning rather than the filling they have promised to give me "at my next appointment." I understand the process of dental procedures, but I have never been to a dentist that has promised me to get my issues fixed during my next appointment only to keep pushing it back further and further with every visit. I have requested a refund for the payment I have already given for the filling I have not received. I was told I would have the money put back on my card over a week ago and it still has not happened. I have tried to call multiple times. I am either put on hold or hung up on before ever speaking to anyone. This is by far the worst experience I have had with any professional practice. I will be finding a local dentist without a doubt.

resp.text: I'm so sorry you didn’t have a positive experience Emily. Patient satisfaction is very important to Aspen Dental practices. If you would like to discuss further, please call me at (315)454-6000, extension 201806. I would be happy to speak with you. Annette, ADMI

name: Robert Robinson
text:
NOT GOOD.  I called for a cleaning for my teeth and a general checkup.  After 3 hours I was told that they would not be able to clean my teeth (the main reason that I had scheduled the appointment) and that my teeth needed approximately $5000 of work.  When I asked how much the cleaning would cost they said $350 plus--way more than I have paid for cleanings in the past.  Consider this:  If I took my vehicle to a mechanics shop to get an oil change (teeth cleaning) but they spent 3 hours evaluating everything else wrong with my car telling me that it would cost $7000 to fix the other items in my car and that they could not do the oil change during this visit--the main reason that I had come to their shop--unless I scheduled another appointment and that it would cost $600 to do the oil change--WAY MORE THAN THE GOING RATE-----------WOULD YOU USE THEM AGAIN?  I think not.

This was absolutely the worse dental experience I have ever had in 60+ years.  WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS CLINIC TO ANYONE!

Any hoot, I played along since they already filed my insurance and I made another appointment.(months later) I was scheduled at 1030am, I showed up ap 10:10....I sat there until11:25 until I finally left. Total waste of time. I would give them a negative 4 if I could. I will say this, the dentist is nice and very professional but he needs to drop the Aspen brand and go into business for himself.

He did not council me about follow up care for my extraction and seemed to be in a bit of a huff about me not scheduling appointments with the hygienist. name: Abby Forrester
text: Incredibly displeased.  The one thing I was impressed by was the fact that I could schedule an appointment online - I chose Apen initially because they seemed to run excellent specials for patients with no dental insurance. After arriving I was taken back for a full set of x-rays, was never asked if I wanted them done, and spent about 20 minutes having them completed. I was then taken back and told the hygenist wasn't in office today so the dentist would be coming by soon. The dentist then came in and performed a gingivitis probe without my consent. She ordered another test and then I was sent to billing - all without my teeth being cleaned which was the sole purpose of my visit. In billing I was told that the new patient process is a two appointment process and I would have to come back later in the week to have my teeth cleaned. I was then given a $306 bill for the services provided without my knowledge or consent. Very displeased with Aspen Dental and will not be returning.

resp.text: I am sorry to hear about your experience. If you would like to discuss further, please call me at (315) 454-6000 ext. 201526 I will be happy to speak with you. — Kelly, ADMI

Horrible place for dentures!!!  My mom had some dentures made here and they have never fit her mouth!!!  When she eats they literally fall out of her month.  Dentures will not stay in place even with denture grip.  She has been to Aspen on numerous occasions to get them adjusted but the dentures still do not fit.  Aspen Dental boast "money back guarantee" so mom finally gave up and returned them.....only to get a letter in the mail two weeks later....telling her to return the dentures or they were going to bill her.  On her last trip there...she had returned them.

During several visits, other patients complaining about the work on their dentures as well.  This is fair warning to avoid this place!

Told her it hurt too bad and I had to be able to talk because the last time someone done a deep cleaning I couldn't talk for 2 days, she said well if u would clean your teeth properly then we wouldnt have to do this. then wanted to put me on a gingivitis regimen. I would have to come back every month to let her do this then every 6 months if I can do it correctly. went to finance dept. wanted to charge me $2000 to pull a tooth that wasn't even a wisdom tooth. Told them I couldnt pay that and she proceeded to tell me get someone to co sign for me. Had them write me a referral for another dentist. The doctor was alright but the other staff terrible and VERY OVERPRICED. they lure u in for the free consult and xrays then try to screw u over with their pricing. Will never go back.

BC/BS provider as per ads so I believe they will take care of me so i’am not in this pain all weekend as my dentist wouldn’t be open til Monday ,,,,well I get there they take an x-Ray of one tooth,the doctor taps on two teeth then tells me I will have to go to the root canal doctor that has done my other root canals and for me to call them Monday ,,I said but the lady on phone said y’all do them ,,they said not anymore at that location that doc was gone 🤷‍♀️🤦‍♀️ So I got nothing done that I needed after taking off work I was in the same position I was before I came here ,,then I get to the billing lady and she informs me that my BC/BS will not cover my exam , but it’s the same insurance I have had for years ,,they have always paid everything but a 30 co-pay on my exams ,,,so I call the same insurance lady from their lobby because they are trying to make me pay all of the fee,,,my insurance lady said you are covered and she wanted to talk to the billing lady ,,,my insurance lady tells me it is all fixed now and they had been just billing it wrong,,ok all taken care of so I get off the phone and wait for billing lady she then comes back and tells me she put it in the computer again and her corporate office sent it back again and I have to pay 100% ✋️😡 this is in front of everyone in lobby I have hated making a scene but I have two blue cross dental policies I pay for never had any problem,,my insurance people tell me and them it’s covered and they still will not take it ,,,,I am forced to pay all of it right there ,,after arguing with her over and over ,, so embarrassing,,,,when I get back to my car I call BC/bs again and they are surprised,,they said but we told them you are covered and how to bill it ,,,,so now my insurance company is going to call me every Friday with an update on getting my money back from this company,,,I would never ever go here again,,,,,Aspen dental did nothing but steal from me and leave me with my same toothache

resp.text: Happy to hear you had a good experience, Linzi! We appreciate your kind words! -- Kelsey, ADMI

name: Isaac Graves
text:
This visit to Aspen Dental was extremely important to me, and I really couldn't be more satisfied. I, personally, have suffered from depression and anxiety for a large part of my life, as well as adolescent gran-mal seizures since I was fifteen years old. The seizures prevent me from being able to drive a car, which prevents me from from being able to get to and from a workplace easily.
Lacking regular funds/insurance coverage, and being anxious and depressed did lead to my neglecting my dental health, which simply exacerbated my anxiety. I suffered a huge panic attack after encountering some (actually relatively minor) dental pain a few days ago. I made an appointment at Aspen Dental for the next morning, which was impressively easy to do online and your staff here at Cox Creek Pkwy did not disappoint me whatsoever; service was extremely professional. Dr. Konradi and the dental hygienist couldn't have done a better job at reassuring me that my shortcomings can be overcome.
My blood pressure at the time was apparently extremely high, most likely a result of the panic attack I suffered the night before, compounded by a minor fever and a lack of sleep. I took my blood pressure this morning and it has thankfully returned to a normal level (111 over 76). I have already purchased the recommended electric toothbrush and a new pro-gum-health toothpaste. I have been instilled with a strong sense of hope already and I have no doubt anymore that I am capable of restoring my dental health. As much as I can, I thank you, and I am looking forward to my next visit whole-heartedly.
Sincerely,
Isaac E. Graves

Like I said probably my own fault for trusting someone else to have my best interest in mind and to be on top of something like that but lesson very painfully learned.)

name: Dennis Olinger
text:
So my two year old son fell and busted his mouth on our driveway one evening. His front tooth got knocked in and was terribly crooked. Blood was everywhere...
My wife was at work..and needless to say..I was a little panicked. My wife came home and we started calling dentists. We came to find out that most dentists are closed on Friday..and it was Thursday evening when this occurred. My son has been a patient at Deerfoot Dental since his teeth really started coming through. We left a message after hours and Dr. Grovestein called us back! He asked us to text him photos of my sons teeth. We sent the pics and he called us back. He reassured us that it probably wasn’t as bad as it seems and he would meet us at his office the next morning. So he opened his clinic for us on his day off! I mean who does that? He gave us instructions to care for the tooth, we made a follow up appointment, and left. Needless to say..our sons tooth looks great. It actually straightened out almost back to its original spot. We went to our follow up appointment and got the good news that his teeth looked great and to just keep a watch on it. I have never in my life experienced customer service from a healthcare provider like this. We are still in shock that someone would care so much about the wellbeing of our son. They have earned a customer for life.

resp.text: It was my pleasure to check your son! Thank you for the kind words!

name: Briana Butler
text: I went here on Monday October 12th, 2020 and I was very disappointed with the wait times and overall service. My appointment was for 9:30 and I arrived at 9:15am. I was not acknowledged when I walked through the door and when I went up to the counter I was met with attitude and a non-sanitized tablet to fill out patient info. In the time of Covid I was very uncomfortable being handed a tablet that someone else just returned a minute before me.... I completed the paperwork within 5 minutes but still had to wait from 9:20am until 10:45 am before I was seen! With no apologies or information given in between all the while people who came in 10, 15, and 20 minutes after me were taken in BEFORE ME. Mind you I did have an appointment I was not a walk in! Right as I was about to leave I was called up and the entire exam plus dentist overview was less than 30 minutes! so I waited over an hour to only be seen for 30 minutes.. The dentist went over my x-rays extremely quick and the exam was maybe 5 minutes. I had to bring up my issues the dentist did not even ask me.. I also think for what they did say was wrong they are very overpriced. Overall not impressed and I will be going to a different dental office.

text: Service in the back is good, however front staff is rude and frequently make mistakes with billing, which they take no responsibility for. Paid for it one time and denied it every since, continuously informing front and back staff that I didn't want it, but somehow it still ends up on my bill and office manager refuses to remove it.

name: Jimmie Bell
text: I have not used Aspen Dental, but after reading the reviews, I will never go there...

resp.text: Hi, Jimmie I’m sorry that you opted out, of discovering what Aspen Dental is all about/or what we can do for you. Each person experiences life in their own way. Often times, a patient can come in with their own preconceived thoughts, as to how the outcome should be. However, when a dentist does the exam, and finds something different, they immediately feel upset. No one likes to get news of possible dental work that will need to be done. It's scary, and costly, we get that. Everyone has their own way of dealing with good and bad situations. We would hope that all our potential patients would rather make up their own decisions, based on their own experiences. You may be pleasantly surprised! Be well - Cindy, ADMI

name: Angela Sneed
text: My appointment was at 8:45 am. I didn’t leave the office until after 11:00. I was told prescriptions were sent to Walgreens. It’s 7:38 pm and I am still without pain meds & antibiotics. I tried calling back to the office numerous times but kept getting the automated system which sent me to the voicemail. I spoke with someone after 5:30 who called in the prescription. But they called it in to the wrong place. So at 7:15 I get a call stating I could pick it up at Walgreens. WRONG!!!! I am at Walgreens and still no medicine. WHY????? Because it was called in at CVS!!!!! So now I have to wait for CVS to back it out of their system so Walgreens can fill the prescription. And guess what, it’s pain meds but no antibiotics!!!! I’m done. It’s my first and last time using ASPEN Dental!!!

text: I do not recommend. I was financed to get my dental work done through a company that they use (Genesys) . Genesys sent a card via mail to swipe whenever I use the services but aspen dental decided to use the entire amount of the loan and applied it to my account as paid for services I never received. I have been paying on this loan since February and finally opened a dispute with Genesys . I never received any dental work and they are now sending over a refund to Genesys . It is now August , they stated I used services and paid in Full in March 2020. They have sent Genesys a refund and it’s taking forever for the refund to process. I will never use them again. They have my utilization very high on my credit card so until they send Genesys the refund , I can’t do anything. They are a scam. Why would you pay yourself for services in full that a patient never received?

text: I would’ve been a New Patient on 7/2/2020 @ 2 ( be remindful I sch this appointment a month in advance). She then stated o no it’s going to be @ September because you are a new patient anyways and we have to reschedule our patients first. I then lol and stated that ok and very Unprofessional  of your Company to allow me to set appt. then they canceled it ( electronically) I then call and the Rep rescheduled me days later then my original appt. then realize I was a NP so pushed me back 2 more months. name: Abigail Kidd
text: I had an appointment scheduled with this dental office since March 2020. Understandably, my appointment was canceled mid-March due to COVID, and I was notified via automated voicemail. I called to reschedule, and they told me there were no available appointments until June 29th. My boyfriend received an appointment for June 11th, arrived 15 minutes early, approached the counter and was told his appointment had been canceled. They offered to reschedule and apologized but said there was nothing they could do, as his appointment had been given to someone else. He had done his paperwork by email and had confirmed his appointment as well. This was not an error on his end. Today, I arrived for my appointment after no communication from Aspen’s end for weeks. I approach the door and it is locked with a note saying the office is closed until July 13th. I was turned away by the lady working inside, while two other patients that had approached the front door were taken inside. I was contacted by one of their managers after I called corporate to explain my frustrations with being turned away after having my appointment for over two months now, and I was told that there was no doctor in office. She explained that the other patients were just “taken inside” and did not elaborate further as to why I wasn’t offered the same efforts. Not sure what exactly the issue is here, besides just poor communication, but I will never be returning. I have no issue with cancelations as I understand it is a very difficult time right now, but I still expect you as a business to have the courtesy to contact your patients and be respectful of their time.

resp.text: I'm really sorry to hear that, Abigail. If you haven't called the Patient Satisfaction team yet, my team would appreciate the opportunity to talk to you: 1-866-767-0890. - Dawn, ADMI

name: Jim S.
text: The people are very nice, but the insurance is a constant battle. My insurance has no copay for routine cleanings but they keep wanting to charge me and then upcharge for "fluoride" and "cancer screening" which do very little if anything at all IMHO. The two times I have been, the dentist on call (different each time) spent maybe three minutes with me, looked in my mouth and xrays and that's all.They did not do any gum measurements not filling adhesion testing as I have always been used to in 30+ years of other dentists. Also entire visit took about 3 hours....easily double of any other experiences. I understand that this is "chain dentistry" so I knew there would be 'some' issues. But again the people are very nice, it just takes a long time and the billing is an issue.

C.J.J.

name: Barbra Crippen
text:
If it was possible, I'd give them a negative star rating!!

I took my aunt to Aspen Dental yesterday & feel that we have been totally messed up. She is a cancer patient undergoing chemo & has lost a lot of weight which we told them.
She has a set of dentures but the bottom plate has never been adjusted to fit well. First the technician who I guess makes the dentures, etc., came in & was able to make an adjustment that would have made them wearable till she had a new set made. When they started to make impressions none of the trays that hold the "goop" was small enough to fit in her mouth???? Never had that problem before.
They ended up using her dentures to make the impressions, getting the goop all over her, then giving her a towelette to clean up with that came from a container that was clearly marked "Do not use on skin".
When we got home & took the bottom denture out of it's baggie, it had been ground down till there was nothing but teeth sitting on a flat base. Called them today to tell them they needed to make her a temporary plate & was told they couldn't do that.  Needless to say we are not going to do business with them. I have been told that they will refund her deposit.

We're going to a "real dentist" tomorrow to start over.

name: nhoenshell
text: I've lived in montgomery for exactly a year now, and I finally managed to schedule a dentist appointment because I was definitely past due for a visit. It was a weird experience at Aspen Dental to be sure, and I cant help but feel as if I was swindled somehow. It was the longest and most expensive dental appointment I've ever had. Being a new patient, I expected extra steps like xrays, but the whole ordeal was weird and confusing from the beginning (starting with when I tried to confirm my appointment via email, which ended up being a phone call, and none of my information was correct in their system). After an awkward xray process, I was led to a room and sat in a chair for about 30 mins. The first obvious red flag that had me wondering if I was getting the wool pulled over my eyes was the TV they stuck in my face (attached to the chair) as the tech and dentist did "paperwork" and talked about teeth stuff amongst themselves behind me completely out of my field of vision. Then the dentist said I had gingivitis and two cavities-- which were a complete shock to me since I've never had any in my life and was experiencing nothing unusual in my mouth during my daily life, no pain or discomfort at all. The gingivitis thing I could understand, I guess (i mean it's a reversible condition from what I understand, so I thought it was weird for them to schedule a whole multi appointment treatment process that would take place throughout the month). I dont know anything about teeth, so you could tell me to open up, poke around in there with tools, and tell me it's a whole huge dangerous mess and I'd have to believe you, because what do I know? What I do know is that the visits to my old dentist were always straight forward and I understood everything they were doing because it was clearly explained and they didn't try to schedule 3 visits in a single month. After all that waiting, tv, and a brief examination, I find myself at the cashier's desk and absolutely no work was done on my teeth. I opted out for the 130$ smart brush that was included in my bill. And then they said they could probably fit me in today for my first treatment after I paid for a large sum that was ultimately un-itemized. The paperwork I received was not a receipt for what I paid for in that moment, but a breakdown of all the work they were going to do and how much it was going to cost me later. I agreed to have the first treatment done right away. Finally, I was going to receive some sort of treatment that was physical during this visit, but I didnt truly understand what I was paying for that warranted such a large bill when I was at the cashier's office. The treatment was no different than what any other dentist would do during a routine cleaning so I'm still not sure why it was so expensive. At the end of my visit, I walked away with a lot of fancy products and with the peace of mind that I didnt have mouth cancer...so, that's a relief. The staff was super friendly and kind, and I really appreciated Loretta. She was absolutely fantastic, but I'm not sure I want to go back to this place at least two more times in a single month just to be broke and confused again. I fully understand that I am dumb, but things just didnt add up.

resp.text: Thank you for providing this information.  I would really like to speak with you.  Will you please call me at (844) 296-0187 ext. 201152 — Julie, ADMI

text: BEWARE!! I told him I had just coughed in my hand and that he should wash his hands, he stated “no I’m good “. Didn’t wash his hands then proceeded to put on gloves to exam my mouth. Before examining, he adjusts his glasses on his face with the gloves on! Then goes into my mouth with the same nasty gloves. He acted as if he didn’t know what treatment plan I should be on. The hygienist told me one thing and he said another. Had to wait another 45 mins to see the “Consultantion Manager “ who told me I should go with treatment plan that the hygienist recommended. NEVER again will I visit this office and I suggest anyone else stays away from it as well!!

name: N Timms
text:
Aspen Dental is the worst. I was quoted $832 by Tanietha to have two of my wisdom teeth extracted with oral surgery on 12/04/2018 and the woman sent my X-ray over to the dentist that would be doing it. And I was told by Tanietha that if they weren’t able to schedule me then they would call me to reschedule. So I went ahead and paid $832 for two of my wisdom teeth to get removed with oral surgery. And it was scheduled for the very next day but I was told that I had to go to the Prattville location. My mouth was hurting so bad that I didn’t mind going to get that relief.  I show up at 1:15 p.m. to my appointment that was supposed to be scheduled for 12/05/2018 at 1:45 p.m. and at first the woman couldn’t find me stating that my appointment was canceled or taken off the schedule. The woman behind the receptionist spoke up because she’s who the Montgomery office spoke to and said she would ask the dentist if he could do it.
The dentist said that he would be able to remove my teeth. So I sit down to make sure the paper work was okay and I was informed that I would have to pay an extra $850 on the spot because they would rather that I be put to sleep. I already paid in full the price that I was given without insurance and drove to the Prattville location. And I was not prepared to pay an additional extra $850 on the spot for a service that I already paid for. I just told them to refund me the money and now I have to find somewhere else because these people are not organized in the least bit. They felt more than happy to take my money but when it was time for the service...it’s oh no ma’am we need more money now. Ridiculous! I’m still waiting on my refund now.
I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND ASPEN DENTAL.

text: I had an appointment for a exam and x ray. During the process I was asked if I had a tooth that was bothering me at the moment,  and i said yes. I asked if i could get it pulled that day. I was told to make another appointment to have it pulled.  During the process of going over the procedures that will be done, make sure you look at the prices. They tried to charge me $153 for a toothbrush. They are all about money. I wanted them to do certain things, but instead they claim other things needed to be done first. Yeah, of course so they can get more money.  They are very unprofessional,  talking about the patients in front of other patients. They gossiping about why this patient came back, and the response wasOh he's complaining about his dentures again. A woman came in to bring one of the staff members some fish, and when I tell you most of the staff got so loud and ghetto over some fish. MY GOODNESS,  even the doctor came out and joined in. Out of all the staff I encountered that day, Cynethia has the most professionalism and she does not fit in that group at all. Actually she should teach the regional manager Felicia some techniques.

name: Jamie Woodward
text: Doctors, nurses and office staff very friendly, quick and efficient. I had been to serval dentists before trying to price dentures or find out what my options were and most were Horrible!! Overpriced, uncaring and downright rude. I really came here expecting more of the same but to my surprise from the first day they were very straight forward with different options and pricing as well as being very friendly and not demeaning. as soon as a plan was in place, I paid a very reasonable price ( way cheaper than most)have been back several times for adjusting, back for permanents, etc and they are always helpful and friendly and I have Never had another charge! I feel so much better about myself now and I can’t thank them enough

text: I’m not sure if I went on the Dr’s off day or what, but I can honestly say don’t make a sound when having an extraction! He was giving me a shot near one of my eye teeth and it hurt really bad! So I starting grunting then started crying and he rudely said LOOK if you can’t handle this then you can go to a oral surgeon and have them cut them out! I apologized that it hurt and basically I would try to be a “good girl” and be quiet!  So I would say NO BED SIDE MANNER AT ALL! I’m highly upset about my visit! I wish I would have stopped right there and went somewhere else! I spent $6,000 in an office to be treated like that! Not happy at all!

So please just know that they don’t know how to make dentures to fit properly...or they just don’t care !!! Believe me ... I will never go back to this office !!!

The staff is wonderful from the front office to the last person that places your beautiful new teeth into your mouth. The price was economical for my treatment. I recommend Affordable Dentures to everyone needing dentures. I am smiling more and with a beautiful new smile. Thank You so much.

text: The doctor is very good at extractions, very good. I had 23 teeth pulled and the pain was minimum. BUT, AS FAR AS THE STAFF THEY ARE HORRIBLE. Plus I get prescribed by a doctor morphine 60 MG and perc. So the Lortab he gave really didn't do much. They r a dentist office but Cindy says they don't have tooth brush she is rude on the phone and at the front desk. Plus everytime I have been here she has food eating it up front at the desk. I understand people must eat but she always is eathing at the front desk. I just think professionally speaking she should eat in the break room and then come to the front desk. I should have listened to the lady who was in the office when I first went in she was very displeased about fit and she was about to pay,again for another doctor to get her dentures and she had already paid for these. My dentures have not fit since I got them they r so loss they float around in my mouth. I've come for adjustments but they don't do it right and make it worse. They have made it to where my gums bleed and /or they fall out thry dont seem to have a midfle ground. If I had to do it all over again I'd go somewhere else.

text: My mother had to have a crown replaced. They told her a price and what her part was going to cost. She paid it right then. Also charged the insurance company for 2 tooth crowns and not just one.

name: BJ Kidd
text: Terrible experience.  Unorganized.  Worked on the correct tooth for one family member but applied Novocain shots to the wrong side of the mouth.  Performed a filling that is failing only after a couple of months.  Another family member sat in the Dentists chair for 2 hours and 30 min without performing any work.  Billing was also a headache very difficult to work with and a confusing bill.  Complete waste of time and money.

name: Keith Foshee
text: Was referred to this place by my Dental Insurance Company.    Called at  3 various times during business hours and got answering service every time.    Very little command of English language.    Left message on 3rd try for someone to please call me back to schedule an appointment.    24 Hours have passed and still no call.    If this is an indication of how they run the business- then I wouldn't do business with them anyway.    So very unprofessional.

text: Anita is awesome! She’s sweet and does her job well!!

text: Tammy was my dental hygienist and she was amazing. I absolutely love how comfortable and aware she made me in the time of my visit. This place is definitely home for me!
